title: User talk:166.203.0.99
content: Please consider starting an account, because I'm not even sure you still have the same IP as I'm writing this (which is why I'll replicate this on my talk page). Most of your edits were very sound, and I apologize because my reverts messed them up. I first took issue with the format (linking dates when all were delinked - it's a long controversy, but whatever preference needs to be consistent in one article). I have separate problems with the two cats for CPSU members and Bolsheviks, which I hadn't noticed before: the former is most likely redundant to Soviet politicians, the latter is frankly absurd (the term is as vague as to mean anything, and its overlap with CPSU members for those it intends to cover is about 100%). But I have kept one and will re-add the other, since I don't want to get tangled in that debate. You were also right on principle about Romanian politicians (which I simply hadn't noticed), but note that he is already in there through the PSDR members category (I since added another more specific and newish category for his case). As for your sorting: I'm fine with any system, I'll revisit yours because it could prove to be better - just give me a moment. [[User:Dahn|Dahn]] ([[User talk:Dahn|talk]]) 23:11, 30 March 2009 (UTC)

title: Talk:Ahora Es (Wisin & Yandel song)
content:
{{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Latin music|class=stub|importance=low|reggaeton=yes}} {{WikiProject Songs|class=stub}} }} == Requested move ==
:''The following is a closed discussion of a [[WP:requested moves|requested move]]. '''Please do not modify it.''' Subsequent comments should be made in a new section on the talk page. Editors desiring to contest the closing decision should consider a [[Wikipedia:move review|move review]]. No further edits should be made to this section. '' The result of the move request was: '''no consensus''' to move the page, per the discussion below. [[User:Dekimasu|Dekimasu]][[User talk:Dekimasu|よ!]] 05:43, 16 October 2014 (UTC) ---- [[:Ahora Es (Wisin & Yandel song)]] → {{no redirect|Ahora Es}} – There aren't other topics covered with such title, and those articles that semi-cover the name "Ahora Es" are not enough to make a disambiguation page, what I was about to do, but I only could find: a song by [[Limi-T 21]] from ''[[Calle Sabor, Esquina Amor]]'' and an album by [[Milly Quezada|Milly y los Vecinos]] titled ''[[Ahora Es!]]''. Also an-I-guess band called [[El Cartel]], apparently independent from Daddy Yankee, released an album, but if they aren't related to Yankee [[EL Cartel (band)|they are in red]]. No films, books, magazines, or TV series have been titled as such. Kind of an ambiguous title, but there is no real reason to create a dab page for 3 entries or disambiguate it now. [[WP:CC-BY-SA|©]] [[User:Tbhotch|Tbhotch]][[User talk:Tbhotch|™]] ([[User:Tbhotch/EN|en-2.5]]). 17:55, 30 September 2014 (UTC) *'''Comment''' - there is a dab, it's at [[Ahora]]. This was mislinking from [[Milly Quezada]] article though her album doesn't have an article yet. [[User:In ictu oculi|In ictu oculi]] ([[User talk:In ictu oculi|talk]]) 21:11, 30 September 2014 (UTC) ::'''Oppose''' - I remember now what the problem is. [[Boricua ¡Ahora Es!]] (English, Boricua, Now it is!) is the Puerto Rico 2012 statehood/independence campaign, and the likely first strike for the term. I've fixed links [[Ahora Es]] should ideally redirect to the [[Ahora]] dab, not the Wisin & Yandel song. 21:15, 30 September 2014 (UTC) ::::Based on Erick's comment below I have split [[Ahora Es]] dab out of [[Ahora]] dab, there are 6 entries. If this move proposal decides that (Wisin & Yandel song) is primary topic then it should move to (disambiguation). [[User:In ictu oculi|In ictu oculi]] ([[User talk:In ictu oculi|talk]]) 23:42, 15 October 2014 (UTC) *'''Oppose''' per IIO, it should be a disambiguation page -- [[Special:Contributions/65.94.171.225|65.94.171.225]] ([[User talk:65.94.171.225|talk]]) 04:10, 1 October 2014 (UTC) *'''Comment''' - I think it would be more convenient to rename this article to '''Ahora Es (song)'''' and leave "Ahora Es" as an disambiguation. A quick search on [http://www.billboard.com/biz/search/charts Billboard.biz] shows that no other song with the same name ranking on the charts and [http://www.allmusic.com/search/songs/Ahora+Es Allmusic]'s database only shows two songs with the same name, but neither of them would pass [[WP:NSONGS]] because they neither ranked on music charts or receive any awards or nominations. [[User:Magiciandude|Erick]] ([[User talk:Magiciandude|talk]]) 18:01, 1 October 2014 (UTC) :::[[User:Magiciandude|Erick]] no objection if you want to split [[Ahora Es]] dab out of [[Ahora]] dab. [[User:In ictu oculi|In ictu oculi]] ([[User talk:In ictu oculi|talk]]) 10:15, 15 October 2014 (UTC) :::: I just noticed that the other song called "Ahora Es" ranked in the UK charts, so I recant my earlier comment. [[User:Magiciandude|Erick]] ([[User talk:Magiciandude|talk]]) 10:21, 15 October 2014 (UTC) :::::[[Ahora Es (2 in a Room song)]] 1995 redirects but did chart, yes. [[User:In ictu oculi|In ictu oculi]] ([[User talk:In ictu oculi|talk]]) 23:29, 15 October 2014 (UTC) *'''Support'''. I don't have access to Google, but I searched for "Ahora Es" on Bing. All the hits on the first page are for this song, nothing about Puerto Rico. [[User:Claimsworth|Claimsworth]] ([[User talk:Claimsworth|talk]]) 05:55, 6 October 2014 (UTC) :::[[User:Claimsworth]] how does a Bing search indicate what is in Google Books? [[User:In ictu oculi|In ictu oculi]] ([[User talk:In ictu oculi|talk]]) 10:09, 15 October 2014 (UTC) ::::Pay attention. This is a song, not a book. The idea is to figure out what topic readers are most likely to be looking for. [[User:Claimsworth|Claimsworth]] ([[User talk:Claimsworth|talk]]) 15:29, 15 October 2014 (UTC) :::::[[User:Claimsworth]], I'm sorry but please see the unavoidable question on your Talk page. [[User:In ictu oculi|In ictu oculi]] ([[User talk:In ictu oculi|talk]]) 23:30, 15 October 2014 (UTC)
:''The above discussion is preserved as an archive of a [[WP:RM|requested move]]. '''Please do not modify it.''' Subsequent comments should be made in a new section on this talk page or in a [[WP:move review|move review]]. No further edits should be made to this section.
===Sock=== Just noting that User:Claimsworth above is a now blocked sock. [[User:In ictu oculi|In ictu oculi]] ([[User talk:In ictu oculi|talk]]) 10:35, 1 November 2014 (UTC)

Barbados West Indies???

This article needs review.

"Marquis de Vallado" it appears was alive during the 1600's.  Barbados has been under full British rule from the 1600's until independence in 1966? The "title" of Marquis de Vallado thas not exist in Spain.

== Welcome! == '''Welcome!''' Hello, and [[Wikipedia:Introduction|welcome]] to Wikipedia! Thank you for [[Special:Contributions/90.212.152.22|your contributions]]. I hope you like the place and decide to stay. Here are some pages you might like to see: * [[Wikipedia:Five pillars|The five pillars of Wikipedia]] * [[Help:Contents|Help pages]] * [[Wikipedia:Tutorial|Tutorial]] * [[Wikipedia:How to edit a page|How to edit a page]] and [[Wikipedia:Article development|How to develop articles]] * [[Wikipedia:Your first article|How to create your first article]] (using the [[Wikipedia:Article wizard|Article Wizard]] if you wish) * [[Wikipedia:Manual of Style|Manual of Style]] You are welcome to continue editing articles without [[Special:Userlogin|logging in]], but many editors recommend that you '''[{{fullurl:Special:Userlogin|type=signup}} create an account]'''. Doing so is free, requires no personal information, and provides several benefits such as the ability to create articles. For a full outline and explanation of the benefits that come with creating an account, please see [[Wikipedia:Why create an account?|this page]]. If you edit without a username, your [[IP address]] (90.212.152.22) is used to identify you instead. In any case, I hope you enjoy editing here and being a [[Wikipedia:Wikipedians|Wikipedian]]! Please [[Wikipedia:Signatures|sign your comments]] on talk pages using four tildes (~~~~); this will automatically produce your IP address (or username if you're logged in) and the date. If you need help, check out [[Wikipedia:Questions]], ask me on [[User talk:XLinkBot|my talk page]], or ask your question and then place {{[[:Category:Wikipedians looking for help|helpme]]}} before the question on this page. Again, welcome! --[[User:XLinkBot|XLinkBot]] ([[User talk:XLinkBot|talk]]) 10:18, 12 March 2011 (UTC) == March 2011 == Welcome to Wikipedia. The external link you added or changed is on my list of links to remove and probably shouldn't be included in Wikipedia. I removed the following link(s): http://www.facebook.com/pages/Underground-Ernie/151055244953670.
If you were trying to insert an [[Wikipedia:External links|external link]] that does comply with our [[Wikipedia:List of policies|policies]] and [[Wikipedia:List of guidelines|guidelines]], then please accept my creator's apologies and feel free to [[WP:UNDO|undo]] the bot's revert. However, if the link does not comply with our policies and guidelines, but your edit included other, constructive, changes to the article, feel free to make those changes again without re-adding the link. Please read Wikipedia's [[WP:EL|external links guideline]] for more information, and consult my [[User:XLinkBot/Reversion reasons|list of frequently-reverted sites]]. title: Talk:List of Golden Plate awardees
content: {{Skip to talk}} {{Talk header}} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject United States|class=List|importance=low|DC=yes|DC-importance=low}} {{WikiProject Organizations}} }} {{Old AfD multi| date = 10 April 2012 (UTC) | result = '''keep''' | page = List of Golden Plate awardees }} {{Connected contributor|WWB Too|editedhere=yes|declared=yes}} ==A few corrections== {{tld|Request edit}} Recently, it has been pointed out to me that this article contains some errors (I admit, they are my own): one misplaced name, and a few omissions compared to the [http://www.achievement.org/autodoc/pagegen/brochure/p1.html official page] this list is derived from. Here are the requested changes: *Move [[Stephen David Bechtel, Sr.]] (1976) from the ''Science'' heading to the ''Business'' heading, placed chronologically between Sanders and MacArthur *Add [[Leontyne Price]] (1986) to ''Arts'', between Papp and Rauschenberg *Add [[Frederick W. Smith]] (1998) to ''Business'', following Hinckley and the semi-colon *Add [[Chuck Berry]] (2002) to ''Arts'', before Dylan As I make this request on behalf of the Academy of Achievement, and I am mindful of Jimbo's wish that paid advocates do not edit article space, I'd like to request that someone implement these changes for me. Cheers, [[User:WWB Too|WWB Too]] ([[User talk:WWB Too|talk]]) 21:10, 3 July 2012 (UTC) :I've done all of them except for Smith. Did you mean add him to Public Service following Hinckley, because that's where Hinckley is, not Business. [[User:Silver seren|Silver]][[User talk:Silver seren|seren]][[Special:Contributions/Silver seren|C]] 21:59, 10 July 2012 (UTC) ::Shoot, I did mean ''Business''—Smith is the founder/CEO of FedEx. I think I'd gotten distracted by my notice of the stray semi-colon after Hinckley under ''Public Service''. Would you mind pulling that as well? Another typo. [[User:WWB Too|WWB Too]] ([[User talk:WWB Too|talk]]) 22:53, 10 July 2012 (UTC) :::Okay, added it and removed the semi-colon. That everything? [[User:Silver seren|Silver]][[User talk:Silver seren|seren]][[Special:Contributions/Silver seren|C]] 23:37, 10 July 2012 (UTC) :::That looks like it. Thanks again! Cheers, [[User:WWB Too|WWB Too]] ([[User talk:WWB Too|talk]]) 11:20, 11 July 2012 (UTC) == Sources needed / back-links needed == For awards articles, each year the award is announced should include a source for that year (using a reliable secondary source, not the award website or PR). This is not a trivial point, a major value of awards articles is to read sources from a particular year. The article has [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:WhatLinksHere/List_of_Golden_Plate_awardees no back links] to the winners. Every winner should have a mention in their article that they won the award, along with a wikilink back to this article (and a source! see above). The procedure when creating awards articles: #List who won the award that year. #Add a source for that year's award. #Create a back-link in the winners article, copying the same source from above. Anything less is incomplete! I see it was a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:WikiProject_Cooperation/Major_Contributions "paid article"], I hope the paying client understands how much better this article can (and should) be. See for example [[William Hill Sports Book of the Year]] though that one has problems too see also [[List of Women's Prize for Fiction winners]] for examples of the direction to head. -- [[User:Green Cardamom|Green Cardamom]] ([[User talk:Green Cardamom|talk]]) 16:13, 16 January 2013 (UTC) == Restoring Page? == This page redirects to the Academy of Achievement, and in keeping with the latest revision there (in which TechnoTalk restored content deleted by user/admin JzG/Guy), I think it should be restored to its original. Understanding the Golden Plate awardees helps a reader evaluate the Academy of Achievement -- much in the way that the Rhodes Scholar page is supplemented by the [[List of Rhodes Scholars]] page. [[User:Qalandariyya|Qalandariyya]] ([[User talk:Qalandariyya|talk]]) 00:16, 21 July 2015 (UTC) : The Rhodes scholarship is vastly more important than this, see [[WP:OTHERSTUFF]]. Virtually everything here is unsourced or sourced only from the Academy itself. [[User Talk:JzG|Guy]] ([[User:JzG/help|Help!]]) 08:15, 21 July 2015 (UTC) :: That was one example -- perhaps [[Kennedy Center Honors]] is more on point? As for your link to [[WP:OTHERSTUFF]] -- see the third one down "'''Keep''' - You say this article is promotional, but there are other articles just as promotional as this one." You're right about the sources, though. I see that TechnoTalk is looking for proper sources and perhaps we can fix this up accordingly. [[User:Qalandariyya|Qalandariyya]] ([[User talk:Qalandariyya|talk]]) 14:32, 21 July 2015 (UTC)

title: User:Sumiharu
content:
SUMI SEVILLA HARU is a producer, actor, journalist, writer and poet. Her company, Iron Lotus Productions, specializes in festival production.  The 21st Annual Mariachi Festival will on November 20, 2011, and the Santa Cecilia Festival will be on November 22 at Mariachi Plaza in Boyle Heights, California.
HARU served on the Screen Actors Guild national board for 33 years and on the Hollywood board for two years.  She served as acting president in 1995, first national vice president with Bill Daniels, Richard Masur and Barry Gordon, and as national recording secretary in four two-year terms with presidents Edward Asner and Patty Duke.  She is the recipient of the 2009 Ralph Morgan Award named after the first Guild president.  HARU was a cofounder and national chair of SAG’s Ethnic Employment Opportunities Committee and a co-drafter and negotiator of “American Scene” and affirmative action clauses of the national TV/Theatrical and Commercials contracts.  The EEOC Career Days were originated by her, and she and helped develop SAG’s national affirmative action conferences. She chaired the Legislative Committee and served as a legislative advocate on the national state and local levels.  She was a trustee and former president of the SAG-Producers Industry Advancement and Cooperative Fund, and is a former board member of the Screen Actors Guild Foundation.
She was the first and only Asian Pacific American to serve as a national vice president of the American Federation of Labor-Congress of Industrial Organizations executive council, elected in 1995 and served until 2001.  She was a co-founder and executive board member of the Asian Pacific American Labor Alliance and served as president of the Los Angeles chapter.

title: User talk:69.115.50.7
content: ==Welcome== Hello, '''{{PAGENAME}}''', and [[Wikipedia:Welcome, newcomers|welcome]] to Wikipedia. Thank you for [[Special:Contributions/{{PAGENAME}}|your contributions]]. I hope you like the place and decide to stay. If you are stuck, and looking for help, please come to the '''[[Wikipedia:New contributors' help page|New contributors' help page]]''', where experienced Wikipedians can answer any queries you have! Or, you can just type '''{{helpme}}''' and your question on your user talk page, and someone will show up shortly to answer. Here are a few good links for newcomers: *[[Wikipedia:Five pillars|The Five Pillars of Wikipedia]] *[[Wikipedia:How to edit a page|How to edit a page]] *[[Wikipedia:Tutorial|Editing tutorial]] *[[Wikipedia:Picture tutorial|Picture tutorial]] *[[Wikipedia:How to write a great article|How to write a great article]] *[[Wikipedia:Naming conventions|Naming conventions]] *[[Wikipedia:Manual of Style|Manual of Style]] I hope you enjoy editing here and being a [[Wikipedia:Wikipedians|Wikipedian]]! By the way, you can sign your name on talk and vote pages using four tildes, like this: ~~~~. If you have any questions, see the [[Wikipedia:Help|help pages]], add a question to the [[Wikipedia:village pump|village pump]] or ask me on my talk page. Again, welcome!

title: 2000 in sports
content:
{{unreferenced|date=February 2013}} '''2000 in sports''' describes the year's events in world sport. {{Year box}} ==[[Alpine skiing]]== * [[Alpine Skiing World Cup]] ** Men's overall season champion: [[Hermann Maier]], Austria ** Women's overall season champion: [[Renate Götschl]], Austria ==[[American football]]== * [[Super Bowl XXXIV]] – [[1999 St. Louis Rams season|St. Louis Rams]] win 23–16 over [[1999 Tennessee Titans season|the Tennessee Titans]] * [[Marshall Faulk]] wins the regular season MVP award. * [[Bowl Championship Series|BCS]] National Championship Game (1999 season) – The [[Florida State University|Florida State Seminoles]] won 49–29 over the [[Virginia Tech Hokies]] ==[[Association football]]== * [[Euro 2000]] – [[French national football team|France]] won 2-1 in extra time over [[Italian national football team|Italy]], with a golden goal by Trézéguet. This was France's second [[UEFA European Football Championship|European Championship]] title. * [[UEFA Champions League|Champions' League]] – [[Real Madrid]] won 3-0 in the final against [[Valencia, CF|Valencia]]. This was [[Real Madrid]]'s 8th European Cup title. * [[UEFA Cup]] – [[Galatasaray S.K. (football team)|Galatasaray]] won 4-1 on penalties, in the final against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]], after a 0-0 draw at the end of the match. This was the first European title won by a Turkish team. * [[European Super Cup]] – [[Galatasaray S.K. (football team)|Galatasaray]] beat [[Real Madrid]] 2-1 after extra time, with a golden goal by Jardel. * [[European/South American Cup|Intercontinental Cup]] – [[Boca Juniors]] beat [[Real Madrid]] 2-1, winning the cup for the second time. ==[[Athletics (track and field)|Athletics]]== * September – [[Athletics at the 2000 Summer Olympics]] held at Sydney, Australia ==[[Australian rules football]]== * [[2000 AFL season|Australian Football League]] ** March 9 – [[Docklands Stadium]] opens with [[Essendon Football Club|Essendon]] 24.12 (156) beating [[Port Adelaide Football Club|Port Adelaide]] 8.14 (62) ** July 15 – Essendon becomes the first club to win its first nineteen games when it beats [[Hawthorn Football Club|Hawthorn]] 25.15 (165) to 13.4 (82). This beats [[Collingwood Football Club|Collingwood]]'s [[perfect regular season|perfect home-and-away season]] of eighteen games from [[1929 VFL season|1929]]. ** August 5 – Essendon become the first AFL team to win 21 of 22 games in a VFL/AFL home-and-away season, losing only to the [[Western Bulldogs]] in its second last game ** Essendon wins the 104th AFL premiership defeating [[Melbourne Football Club|Melbourne]] 19.21 (135) to 11.9 (75). ** [[Brownlow Medal]] awarded to [[Shane Woewodin]] (Melbourne) ==[[Baseball]]== {{main|2000 in baseball}} {{see also|2000 Major League Baseball season}} * [[Major League Baseball]] dissolves the [[National League|National]] and [[American League]]s as separate legal entities, although retaining them as competitive entities. From this point forward, the leagues’ functions are consolidated in the office of the [[Commissioner of Baseball]]. * [[2000 World Series|World Series]] – [[2000 New York Yankees season|New York Yankees]] win 4 games to 1 over the [[2000 New York Mets season|New York Mets]]. The Series MVP is [[Derek Jeter]] of the Yankees * [[2000 Japan Series|Japan Series]] – The [[Yomiuri Giants]] defeat the [[Fukuoka Daiei Hawks]] 4 games to 2. The Giants' [[Hideki Matsui]] is named Series MVP. ==[[Basketball]]== * [[NBA Finals]] – ** [[1999–2000 Los Angeles Lakers season|Los Angeles Lakers]] win their first NBA title in twelve years, defeating [[1999–2000 Indiana Pacers season|the Indiana Pacers]] 4 games to 2. * [[NCAA Men's Basketball Championship]] – ** Michigan State wins 89–76 over Florida * [[WNBA|WNBA Finals]] – ** [[Houston Comets]] win 2 games to 0 over the [[New York Liberty]] to complete their four–peat.\ * [[Euroleague Basketball|Euroleague]] Final: ** [[Panathinaikos BC|Panathinaikos]] defeats [[Maccabi Tel Aviv B.C.|Maccabi Tel Aviv]] 73–67 for the title. * [[National Basketball League (Australia)]] Finals: ** [[Perth Wildcats]] defeated the [[Victoria Titans]] 2–0 in the best–of–three final series. * European basketball enters a new era with the creation of the [[Euroleague Basketball (company)]]. This leads to a rift with [[FIBA Europe]] and the creation of two separate continent-wide competitions for the 2000–01 season—the [[SuproLeague]], operated by FIBA Europe, and Euroleague Basketball's [[2000–01 Euroleague|Euroleague]]. ==[[Boxing]]== * May 13 to May 21 – [[2000 European Amateur Boxing Championships]] held in [[Tampere]], Finland * July 29 – [[Kostya Tszyu]] defeats [[Julio César Chávez]] by a knockout in six to retain the [[World Boxing Council|WBC's]] world Jr. Welterweight title. * August 12 – [[Evander Holyfield]] defeats [[John Ruiz]] by decision in 12 rounds to regain the [[World Boxing Association|WBA]]'s world Heavyweight title, becoming the first boxer to win the world Heavyweight title four times. * ''[[The Ring (magazine)|The Ring]]'' named [[Félix Trinidad]] the "Fighter of the Year 2000". Eric Morales won a 12 round points victory over Marco Antonio Barrera, for the unified WBC and WBO 122 Pound Titles, in ''The Ring's'' "Fight of The Year 2000". ==[[Canadian football]]== * [[Grey Cup]] – [[B.C. Lions]] win 28–26 over the [[Montreal Alouettes]] * [[Vanier Cup]] – [[Ottawa Gee-Gees]] win 42–39 over the [[Regina Rams]] ==[[Cricket]]== * June 26 – Bangladesh becomes the tenth [[Test cricket]] playing nation. ==[[Cycle racing]]== '''[[Road bicycle racing]]''' * [[2000 Giro d'Italia|Giro d'Italia]] – [[Stefano Garzelli]] * [[2000 Tour de France|Tour de France]] – [[Lance Armstrong]] (Rescinded) * [[2000 UCI Road World Championships|World Road Cycling Championship]] – [[Romans Vainšteins]] '''[[Cyclo-cross]]''' * [[2000 UCI Cyclo-cross World Championships]] ** Men's Competition won by [[Richard Groenendaal]] ** Women's Competition won by [[Hanka Kupfernagel]] ==[[Dogsled racing]]== * [[Iditarod Trail Sled Dog Race|Iditarod Trail Sled Dog Race Champion]] ** [[Doug Swingley]] wins with lead dogs: ''Stormy'' & ''Cola'' ==[[Field hockey]]== * Olympic Games Men's Competition: Netherlands * Olympic Games Men's Competition: Australia ==[[Figure skating]]== * [[World Figure Skating Championships]] – ** Men's champion: [[Alexei Yagudin]], Russia ** Ladies' champion: [[Michelle Kwan]], United States ** Pairs' champions: [[Maria Petrova (figure skater)|Maria Petrova]] and [[Alexei Tikhonov]], Russia ** Ice dance champions: [[Marina Anissina]] and [[Gwendal Peizerat]], France * First World [[Synchronized skating|Synchronized Skating]] Championships held in [[Minneapolis]] ==[[Gaelic Athletic Association]]== *'''[[Camogie]]''' ** All–Ireland Camogie Champion: [[Tipperary GAA|Tipperary]] ** National Camogie League: [[Cork GAA|Cork]] *'''[[Gaelic football]]''' ** [[All-Ireland Senior Football Championship]] – [[Kerry GAA|Kerry]] 0–17 beats [[Galway GAA|Galway]] 1–10 ** [[National Football League (Ireland)|National Football League]] – [[Derry GAA|Derry]] 1–8 beats [[Meath GAA|Meath]] 0–9 ** [[Sligo Senior Football Championship]] – Bunninadden were crowned County Champions by defeating Coolera/Strandhill ** [[Dublin Senior Football Championship]] – [[Na Fianna]] were crowned County Champions by defeating [[Kilmacud Crokes]] *'''[[Ladies' Gaelic football]]''' ** All-Ireland Senior Football Champion: [[Mayo GAA|Mayo]] ** National Football League: [[Mayo GAA|Mayo]] *'''[[Hurling]]''' ** [[All-Ireland Senior Hurling Championship]] – [[MAYO GAA|Kilkenny]] 5–15 died [[Offaly GAA|Offaly]] 1–14 ** [[National Hurling League]] – ==[[Golf]]== '''Men's professional''' * [[Masters Tournament]] – [[Vijay Singh]] * [[U.S. Open (golf)|U.S. Open]] – [[Tiger Woods]] wins by 15 shots, a record for all majors, with a U.S. Open to–par record score of –12. * [[The Open Championship|British Open]] – [[Tiger Woods]] becomes the fifth golfer in history to achieve the modern "career grand slam", and sets the to–par record for all majors (–19). * [[PGA Championship]] – [[Tiger Woods]] becomes the first golfer since [[Ben Hogan]] in 1953 to win three majors in a calendar year. He ties the to–par record for the PGA (–18) with [[Bob May (golfer)|Bob May]], and wins in a playoff. * [[PGA Tour]] money leader – [[Tiger Woods]] – $9,188,321 * [[PGA Tour#Player and rookie of the year awards|PGA Tour Player of the Year]] – [[Tiger Woods]] * [[PGA Tour#Player and rookie of the year awards|PGA Tour Rookie of the Year]] – [[Michael Clark II]] * [[Tiger Woods]] set or tied a total This event featured, [[Dan Severn]] as a referee for the preliminary bouts.}} |-align=center |April 14 |[[UFC 25|UFC 25: Ultimate Japan 3]] |{{N/A}} |{{flagicon|JPN}} Tokyo, Japan |{{N/A}} |{{N/A}} |{{small|This event was held to determine the new light heavyweight champion following [[Frank Shamrock]]'s retirement from the UFC.}} |-align=center |May 1 |[[Pride Grand Prix 2000 Finals]] |{{N/A}} |{{flagicon|JPN}} Tokyo, Japan |38,429 |{{N/A}} |{{small|[[Mark Coleman]] becomes the Pride 2000 openweight Grand Prix champion. The event featured a highly anticipated match between [[Royce Gracie]] against [[Kazushi Sakuraba]].}} |-align=center |June 4 |[[2000 in Pride FC#Pride 9 - New Blood|Pride 9: New Blood]] |{{N/A}} |{{flagicon|JPN}} [[Nagoya]], Japan |{{N/A}} |{{N/A}} |{{small|[[Matt Serra]] was to fight on this card, but his opponent, Johil de Oliveira, was injured by a pyrotechnics explosion at the event.}} |-align=center |June 9 |[[UFC 26|UFC 26: Ultimate Field Of Dreams]] |{{N/A}} |{{flagicon|USA}} [[Cedar Rapids, Iowa]], United States |{{N/A}} |{{N/A}} |{{small|This event featured the first UFC "bantamweight" bout as defined as 155lbs.}} |-align=center |August 27 |[[2000 in Pride FC#Pride 10 - Return of the Warriors|Pride 10 – Return of the Warriors]] |{{N/A}} |{{flagicon|JPN}} [[Tokorozawa, Saitama]], Japan |35,000 |{{N/A}} |{{N/A}} |-align=center |September 22 |UFC 27: Ultimate Bad Boyz |{{N/A}} |{{flagicon|USA}} [[New Orleans]], United States |{{N/A}} |{{N/A}} |{{small|UFC veteran [[Frank Shamrock]] replaced [[Jeff Blatnick]] in the announcers booth for this event.}} |-align=center |October 31 |[[2000 in Pride FC#Pride 11 - Battle of the Rising Sun|Pride 11 – Battle of the Rising Sun]] |{{N/A}} |{{flagicon|JPN}} [[Osaka]], Japan |13,500 |{{N/A}} |{{N/A}} |-align=center |November 17 |[[UFC 28|UFC 28: High Stakes]] |{{N/A}} |{{flagicon|USA}} [[Atlantic City, New Jersey]], United States |{{N/A}} |{{N/A}} |{{small|UFC rule change, [[New Jersey State Athletic Control Board|New Jersey SACB]] becomes the first state to regulate MMA in the USA. Uses newly written [[Mixed martial arts rules#Unified rules|Unified Rules of Mixed Martial Arts]]. This event held the first and only UFC super heavyweight bout.}} |-align=center |December 9 |[[2000 in Pride FC#Pride 12 - Cold Fury|Pride 12 – Cold Fury]] |{{N/A}} |{{flagicon|JPN}} [[Saitama, Saitama|Saitama]], Japan |26,882 |{{N/A}} |{{N/A}} |-align=center |December 16 |[[UFC 29|UFC 29: Defense of the Belts]] |{{N/A}} |{{flagicon|JPN}} Tokyo, Japan |1,414 |{{N/A}} |{{small|This was the last UFC event held by SEG. Because in January 2001, SEG sold the UFC to current owners [[Zuffa|Zuffa LLC]].}} |-align=center {{s-end}} ==[[Motor racing]]== * [[Stock car racing]] – ** [[NASCAR Championship]] – [[Bobby Labonte]] ** [[Adam Petty]], [[Kenny Irwin, Jr.]], [[Scott Baker (autoracer)|Scott Baker]] and [[Tony Roper (racing driver)|Tony Roper]] all died from head–related injuries that brought safety concerns to [[NASCAR]] ** February 20 – 2000 NASCAR Winston Cup Series [[Daytona 500]] won by [[Dale Jarrett]] ** February 27 – 2000 NASCAR Winston Cup Series Dura-Lube/Kmart 400 at North Carolina Motor Speedway won by Bobby Labonte * [[Indy Racing League]] – [[Buddy Lazier]] won the season championship * [[Indianapolis 500]]– [[Juan Pablo Montoya]] * [[Champcars|CART Racing]] – [[Gil de Ferran]] won the season championship * [[Formula One|Formula One Championship]] – [[Michael Schumacher]] of Germany * [[24 Hours of Le Mans]] – [[Frank Biela]] / [[Tom Kristensen (racing driver)|Tom Kristensen]] / [[Emanuele Pirro]] won driving an [[Audi]] R8R LMP * [[World Rally Championship]] – [[Marcus Grönholm]] of Finland * [[Drag racing]] – [[Gary Scelzi]] won the [[NHRA]] "[[Top Fuel]]" championship. * V8 Supercars – Mark Skaife won the 2000 championship ==[[Radiosport]]== * The third [[World Radiosport Team Championship]] held in [[Ljubljana]], [[Slovenia]]. Gold medals won by Jeff Steinman N5TJ and Dan Street K1TO of the United States. * Tenth [[Amateur Radio Direction Finding]] World Championships are held in [[Nanjing]], China, the first time ever to be hosted at a location outside Europe. ==[[Rugby league]]== * January 22, [[Wigan, England|Wigan]], England – [[2000 World Club Challenge]] is won by the [[Melbourne Storm]] who defeat [[St Helens RLFC|St. Helens]] 44 – 6 at [[JJB Stadium]] before 13,394. * April 21, [[Sydney, Australia|Sydney]], Australia – 2000 [[ANZAC test match]] is won by [[Australian Kangaroos|Australia]] 52–0 against [[New Zealand Kiwis|New Zealand]] at [[Telstra Stadium|Stadium Australia]] before 26,023. * April 29, [[Murrayfield Stadium]] – [[2000 Challenge Cup]] tournament culminates in the [[Bradford Bulls]]' 24 – 18 win in the final against the [[Leeds Rhinos]]. * June 5, [[Suncorp Stadium]] – [[2000 State of Origin series]] is wrapped up by [[New South Wales rugby league team|New South Wales]] in game two of the series against [[Queensland Maroons|Queensland]]. * August 27, [[Stadium Australia]] – [[2000 NRL season]] culminates in the [[Brisbane Broncos]]' 14-6 win in the grand final against the [[Sydney Roosters]]. * October 14, [[Old Trafford]] – [[Super League V]] culminates in [[St Helens RLFC|St Helens]]' 29-16 win in the grand final against [[Wigan Warriors]]. * November 20, [[Crown Flatt]] – [[2000 Rugby League Emerging Nations Tournament|2000 Emerging Nations Tournament]] is won by the [[British Amateur Rugby League Association]] who defeated [[Italy national rugby league team|Italy]] 20-14 in the final. * November 25, [[Old Trafford]] – [[2000 Rugby League World Cup|2000 World Cup]] tournament culminates in [[Australian rugby league team|Australia]]'s 40-12 win in the final against [[New Zealand Kiwis|New Zealand]]. ==[[Rugby union]]== * [[Italy national rugby union team|Italy]] is admitted to the former Five Nations Championship which now establishes its current Six Nations format * 106th [[Six Nations Championship]] series is won by [[England national rugby union team|England]] * [[2000 Tri Nations Series|Tri Nations]] – [[Australia national rugby union team|Australia]] ==[[Snooker]]== * [[2000 World Snooker Championship|World Snooker Championship]] – [[Mark Williams (snooker player)|Mark Williams]] beats [[Matthew Stevens]] 18–16 * [[Snooker world rankings|World rankings]] – [[Mark Williams (snooker player)|Mark Williams]] becomes [[List of world number-one snooker players|world number one]] for [[Snooker season 2000/2001|2000/01]] ==[[Swimming (sport)|Swimming]]== * Fifth [[2000 FINA Short Course World Championships|World Short Course Championships]], held in [[Athens, Greece|Athens]], Greece (March 16 – March 19) ** United States wins the most medals (25), and the most gold medals (9) * 25th [[European LC Championships 2000|European LC Championships]], held in [[Helsinki, Finland|Helsinki]], Finland (July 3 – August 9) ** Romania wins the most medals (14), Sweden and Russia the most gold medals (6) * [[Swimming at the 2000 Summer Olympics|XXVII Olympic Games]], held in [[Sydney, Australia|Sydney]], Australia (September 16 – September 23) * Fourth [[European SC Championships 2000|European SC Championships]], held in [[Valencia]], Spain (December 14 – December 17) ** Great Britain wins the most medals (19), Sweden the most gold medals (10) * January 18 – Australia's [[Susie O'Neill]] breaks her own [[World record progression 200m butterfly|world record]] in the 200 m butterfly (short course) again, this time at a meet in [[Sydney, Australia|Sydney]], Australia, clocking 2:04.16. * February 12 – In [[Paris, France|Paris]], France, US–swimmer [[Jenny Thompson]] betters her own world record in the women's 100 m butterfly (short course), from 56:90 to 56:80. * March 18 – Jenny Thompson again betters her own world record in the women's 100 m butterfly (short course), this time in [[Athens, Greece|Athens]], Greece, from 56:80 to 56:56. * March 23 – [[Anthony Ervin]] breaks the [[World record progression 50 m freestyle|world record]] in the men's 50 m freestyle (short course) at a swimming meet in [[Minneapolis]], clocking 21.21. * June 16 – At the Russian National Swimming Championships in Moscow, [[Alexander Popov (swimmer)|Alexander Popov]] betters the ten-year-old world record (21.81) in the [[World record progression 50 m freestyle|50m freestyle]] (long course), swam by USA's [[Tom Jager]] in 1990 – 21.64. ==[[Tennis]]== * [[Grand Slam in tennis]] men's results: *# [[Australian Open]] – [[Andre Agassi]] *# [[French Open]] – [[Gustavo Kuerten]] *# [[Wimbledon championships]] – [[Pete Sampras]] *# [[US Open (tennis)|US Open]] – [[Marat Safin]] * [[Grand Slam in tennis]] women's results: *# [[Australian Open]] – [[Lindsay Davenport]] *# [[French Open]] – [[Mary Pierce]] *# [[Wimbledon championships]] – [[Venus Williams]] *# [[US Open (tennis)|US Open]] – [[Venus Williams]] * [[Tennis at the 2000 Summer Olympics|2000 Summer Olympics]] **'''Men's Singles Competition''' – [[Yevgeny Kafelnikov]] **'''Women's Singles Competition''' – [[Venus Williams]] **'''Men's Doubles Competition''' – [[Sébastien Lareau]] & [[Daniel Nestor]] **'''Women's Doubles Competition''' – [[Venus Williams]] & [[Serena Williams]] * [[Davis Cup]] ** Spain wins 3–1 over Australia in world tennis ==[[Volleyball]]== * Men's World League: Italy * Women's World Grand Prix: Cuba * Olympic Games Men's Competition – Yugoslavia * Olympic Games Women's Competition – Cuba ==[[Water polo]]== * Olympic Games men's competition: Hungary * Olympic Games women's competition: Australia ==[[Yacht racing]]== * New Zealand retains the [[America's Cup]] as [[Team New Zealand]] defeats Italian challenger, [[Luna Rossa Challenge|Luna Rossa]], 5 races to 0 ==[[Multi-sport event]]s== * [[2000 Summer Olympics]] held at Sydney ** United States wins the most medals (97) and the most gold medals (40). * [[Goodwill Games|Winter Goodwill Games]] held at [[Lake Placid, New York|Lake Placid]], New York ==Awards== * [[Associated Press Athlete of the Year#List of award winners|Associated Press Male Athlete of the Year]] – [[Tiger Woods]], [[PGA Tour]] golfer * [[Associated Press Athlete of the Year#List of award winners|Associated Press Female Athlete of the Year]] – [[Marion Jones]], [[Track and Field]] * [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]]'s [[Wide World of Sports (U.S. TV series)|Wide World of Sports]] Athlete of the Year: Tiger Woods, PGA Tour golfer. Note that the Wide World award was discontinued in 2001. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Sports by year 1951 – 2000}} [[Category:Sports by year]] [[Category:2000 in sports| ]]

==Welcome to Wikipedia== {{#ifeq: {{lc:{{BASEPAGENAME}}}} | {{uc:{{BASEPAGENAME}}}} | {{#ifeq:{{ns:0}}|| '''Welcome!''' Hello, and [[Wikipedia:Introduction|welcome]] to Wikipedia! Thank you for [[Special:Contributions/{{BASEPAGENAME}}|your contributions]]{{#if:|, such as the one you made to [[:{{{art}}}]]|}}. I hope you like the place and decide to stay. Here are some pages you might like to see: * [[Wikipedia:Five pillars|The five pillars of Wikipedia]] * [[Help:Contents|Help pages]] * [[Wikipedia:Tutorial|Tutorial]] * [[Wikipedia:How to edit a page|How to edit a page]] and [[Wikipedia:Article development|How to develop articles]] * [[Wikipedia:Your first article|How to create your first article]] (using the [[Wikipedia:Article wizard2.0|Article Wizard]] if you wish) * [[Wikipedia:Manual of Style|Manual of Style]] You are welcome to continue editing articles without [[Special:Userlogin|logging in]], but you may wish to '''[{{fullurl:Special:Userlogin|type=signup}} create an account]'''. Doing so is free, requires no personal information, and provides several benefits such as the ability to create articles. For a full outline and explanation of the benefits that come with creating an account, please see [[Wikipedia:Why create an account?|this page]]. If you edit without a username, your [[IP address]] ({{ROOTPAGENAME}}) is used to identify you instead. In any case, I hope you enjoy editing here and being a [[Wikipedia:Wikipedians|Wikipedian]]! Please [[Wikipedia:Signatures|sign your comments]] on talk pages using four tildes (~~~~); this will automatically produce your IP address (or username if you're logged in) and the date. If you need help, check out [[Wikipedia:Questions]], ask me on [[User talk:4wajzkd02|my talk page]], or ask your question and then place {{[[:Category:Wikipedians looking for help|helpme]]}} before the question on this page. Again, welcome! |{{error|'''Substitution required. Replace {{welcome-anon}} with {{subst:welcome-anon}}.'''}}}} | '''Welcome!''' Hello, {{BASEPAGENAME}}, and [[Wikipedia:Introduction|welcome]] to Wikipedia! Thank you for [[Special:Contributions/{{BASEPAGENAME}}|your contributions]]{{#if:|, especially what you did for [[:{{{art}}}]]}}. I hope you like the place and decide to stay. Here are some pages that you might find helpful: *[[Wikipedia:Five pillars|The five pillars of Wikipedia]] *[[Wikipedia:Tutorial|Tutorial]] *[[Wikipedia:How to edit a page|How to edit a page]] and [[Wikipedia:Article development|How to develop articles]] *[[Wikipedia:Your first article|How to create your first article]] (using the [[Wikipedia:Article wizard2.0|Article Wizard]] if you wish) *[[Wikipedia:Manual of Style|Manual of Style]] I hope you enjoy editing here and being a [[Wikipedia:Wikipedians|Wikipedian]]! Please [[Wikipedia:Signatures|sign]] your messages on [[Wikipedia:talk page|discussion page]]s using four [[tilde]]s (~~~~); this will automatically insert your username and the date. If you need help, check out [[Wikipedia:Questions]], ask me on {{#if:{{#if:4wajzkd02|4wajzkd02}}|[[user talk:{{#if:4wajzkd02|4wajzkd02}}|my talk page]]|my talk page}}, or ask your question on this page and then place {{helpme}} before the question. Again, welcome! }} == Warnings ==

'''Fortín de las Flores''' is a [[Settlement classification in Mexico|city]] in the [[Mexican state]] of [[Veracruz]].  Fortín de las Flores is the municipal seat of [[Fortín]] municipality, which borders the municipalities of [[Córdoba, Veracruz|Córdoba]], [[Naranjal, Veracruz|Naranjal]] and [[Ixtaczoquitlán]]. It stands on [[Mexican Federal Highway|Federal Highways 190]] and [[Mexican Federal Highway|180]] and the [[Mexico City]] to [[Veracruz, Veracruz|Veracruz]] railway.

In the 2005 INEGI Census, the city reported a total population of 18,965, with 53,311 in the surrounding municipality.<ref>
{{cite web |url=http://www.e-local.gob.mx/work/templates/enciclo/veracruz/municipios/30068a.htm |title=Fortín |work=Enciclopedia de los Municipios de México |publisher=[[INAFED]] |accessdate=2008-11-06}}</ref>

The ravine of [[Metlac]], which borders the {{ill|es|Parque nacional Cañón del Río Blanco|lt=Cañón del Río Blanco National Park}},<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www2.inecc.gob.mx/publicaciones/libros/108/ver.html |title=Parque Nacional Cañón del Río Blanco |author= |date=27 August 2007 |work= |publisher=Instituto Nacional de Ecología y Cambio Climático |accessdate=29 March 2016}}</ref> is the most famous feature of Fortín de las Flores.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.lonelyplanet.com/mexico/central-gulf-coast/fortin-de-las-flores/activities/hiking-trekking/barranca-de-metlac |title=Barranca de Metlac |work= |publisher=Lonely Planet. |accessdate=29 March 2016}}</ref>

The residents of Fortín de las Flores are considered by [[freighthopping]] [[Central America]]n [[migrant workers|migrant]]s to be some of the most generous in Mexico.<ref>[[Sonia Nazario|Nazario, Sonia]]. ''[[Enrique's Journey]]''. New York: Random House, 2006. p. 104</ref>

[[File:Barranca de Metlac Ver. Mexico (21819266676).jpg|thumbnail|left|300px|Barranca de Metlac (the ravince of Metlac) in an early 20th century postcard.]]

title: User talk:Lana14~enwiki
content:
== Your account will be renamed ==
Hello, The developer team at Wikimedia is making some changes to how accounts work, as part of our on-going efforts to provide new and better tools for our users like cross-wiki notifications. These changes will mean you have the same account name everywhere. This will let us give you new features that will help you edit and discuss better, and allow more flexible user permissions for tools. One of the side-effects of this is that user accounts will now have to be unique across all 900 Wikimedia wikis. See [[m:Special:MyLanguage/Single User Login finalisation announcement|the announcement]] for more information. Unfortunately, your account clashes with another account also called Lana14. To make sure that both of you can use all Wikimedia projects in future, we have reserved the name Lana14~enwiki that only you will have. If you like it, you don't have to do anything. If you do not like it, you can [[Special:GlobalRenameRequest|pick out a different name]]. If you think you might own all of the accounts with this name and this message is in error, please visit [[Special:MergeAccount]] to check and attach all of your accounts to prevent them from being renamed. Your account will still work as before, and you will be credited for all your edits made so far, but you will have to use the new account name when you log in. Sorry for the inconvenience. Yours,
[[m:User:Keegan (WMF)|Keegan Peterzell]]
Community Liaison, Wikimedia Foundation
01:04, 20 March 2015 (UTC) == Renamed ==

title: User talk:TruthGuy24
content:
==Notability of [[:Willy Classen]]== [[Image:Information_icon.svg|left]]Hello, this is a message from [[User:Android Mouse Bot 2|an automated bot]]. A tag has been placed on [[:Willy Classen]], by {{#ifeq:1|1|[[User:67.175.147.74|67.175.147.74]],}} another Wikipedia user, requesting that it be [[Wikipedia:Speedy deletions|speedily deleted]] from Wikipedia. The tag claims that it should be speedily deleted because [[:Willy Classen]] seems to be about a person, group of people, band, club, company, or web content, but it does not indicate how or why the subject is notable: that is, why an article about that subject should be included in an encyclopedia. Under the [[WP:CSD#Articles|criteria for speedy deletion]], articles that do not assert the subject's importance or significance may be deleted at any time. Please [[Wikipedia:Notability|see the guidelines for what is generally accepted as notable]].

To contest the tagging and request that administrators wait before possibly deleting [[:Willy Classen]], please affix the template {{hangon}} to the page, and put a note on its talk page. '''This bot is only informing you of the nomination for speedy deletion, it did not nominate [[:Willy Classen]] itself.''' Feel free to leave a message on [[User_talk:Android Mouse|the bot operator's talk page]] if you have any questions about this or any problems with this bot. Thanks. --[[User:Android Mouse Bot 2|Android Mouse Bot 2]] 22:54, 25 May 2007 (UTC)

title: User talk:Maxeylife
content:
'''Welcome!''' Hello, Maxeylife, and [[Wikipedia:Welcome, newcomers|welcome]] to Wikipedia! Thank you for [[Special:Contributions/Maxeylife|your contributions]]. I hope you like the place and decide to stay. Unfortunately, one or more of the pages you created, such as [[Cheyenne Maxey]], may not conform to some of Wikipedia's [[Wikipedia:List of policies|guidelines]], and may soon be deleted. There's a page about creating articles you may want to read called '''[[Wikipedia:Your first article|Your first article]]'''. If you are stuck, and looking for help, please come to the '''[[Wikipedia:New contributors' help page|New contributors' help page]]''', where experienced Wikipedians can answer any queries you have! Or, you can just type '''{{t|helpme}}''' on this page, and someone will show up shortly to answer your questions. Here are a few other good links for newcomers: * [[Wikipedia:Starting an article|Starting an article]] * [[Wikipedia:Your first article|Your first article]] * [[Wikipedia:Biographies of living persons|Biographies of living persons]] * [[Wikipedia:How to write a great article|How to write a great article]] * [[Wikipedia:Five pillars|The five pillars of Wikipedia]] * [[Help:Contents|Help pages]] * [[Wikipedia:Tutorial|Tutorial]] I hope you enjoy editing here and being a [[Wikipedia:Wikipedians|Wikipedian]]! Please [[Wikipedia:Signatures|sign your name]] on talk pages using four tildes (~~~~); this will automatically produce your name and the date. If you have any questions, check out [[Wikipedia:Questions]] or ask me on my talk page. Again, welcome! '''[[User:Acroterion|Acroterion]] [[User talk:Acroterion|(talk)]]''' 23:15, 10 May 2012 (UTC) ==[[Wikipedia:Criteria for speedy deletion|Speedy deletion]] nomination of [[:Cheyenne Maxey]]== [[Image:Ambox warning pn.svg|48px|left|alt=|link=]] {{Quote box|quote=

If this is the first article that you have created, you may want to read [[WP:Your first article|the guide to writing your first article]].

You may want to consider using the [[Wikipedia:Article wizard|Article Wizard]] to help you create articles.

|width=20%|align=right}} A tag has been placed on [[:Cheyenne Maxey]] requesting that it be speedily deleted from Wikipedia. This has been done under [[WP:CSD#A7|section A7 of the criteria for speedy deletion]], because the article appears to be about a person or group of people, but it does not indicate how or why the subject is important or significant: that is, why an article about that subject should be included in an encyclopedia. Under the [[WP:CSD#Articles|criteria for speedy deletion]], such articles may be deleted at any time. Please [[Wikipedia:Notability|see the guidelines for what is generally accepted as notable]]. If you think that the page was nominated in error, contest the nomination by clicking on the button labelled "Click here to contest this speedy deletion" in the speedy deletion tag. Doing so will take you to the talk page where you can explain why you believe the page should not be deleted. You can also visit '''[[Talk:Cheyenne Maxey|the page's talk page directly]]''' to give your reasons, but be aware that once a page is tagged for speedy deletion, it may be removed without delay. Please do not remove the speedy deletion tag yourself, but do not hesitate to add information that is consistent with [[Wikipedia:List of policies|Wikipedia's policies and guidelines]]. If the page is deleted, you can contact [[:Category:Wikipedia administrators who will provide copies of deleted articles|one of these administrators]] to request that the administrator [[Wikipedia:Userfication#Userfication of deleted content|userfy]] the page or email a copy to you. '''[[User:Acroterion|Acroterion]] [[User talk:Acroterion|(talk)]]''' 23:15, 10 May 2012 (UTC)

title: User talk:212.51.122.24
content:
==Your recent edits==
Hi there. In case you didn't know, when you add content to [[Wikipedia:Talk page|talk pages]] and Wikipedia pages that have open discussion, you should [[Wikipedia:Signatures|sign your posts]] by typing four [[tilde]]s  ( ~~~~ ) at the end of your comment. On many keyboards, the tilde is entered by holding the [[Shift key]], and pressing the key with the tilde pictured.  You may also click on the signature button [[Image:Button sig2.png]] located above the edit window.  This will automatically insert a signature with your name and the time you posted the comment. This information is useful because other editors will be able to tell who said what, and when. Thank you!<!-- Template:Tilde --> --[[User:SineBot|SineBot]] ([[User talk:SineBot|talk]]) 17:51, 6 January 2008 (UTC)

'''''Nahla''''' is a 1979 Algerian [[drama film]] directed by [[Farouk Beloufa]].<ref name="africine">{{cite web |url=http://www.africine.org/?menu=art&no=9531 |title=Nahla, de Farouk Beloufa |accessdate=2013-01-19 |work=africine}}</ref><ref name="timeoutbeirut">{{cite web |url=http://www.timeoutbeirut.com/film/article/3675/farouk-beloufa.html |title=Farouk Beloufa |accessdate=2013-01-19 |work=Time Out Beirut}}</ref><ref name="dailystar">{{cite web |url=http://www.dailystar.com.lb/Culture/Film/Sep/21/A-rare-Algerian-vision-of-Lebanon.ashx#axzz2IRka9joJ |title=A rare Algerian vision of Lebanon |accessdate=2013-01-19 |work=dailystar.com}}</ref><ref name="beirutdc">{{cite web |url=http://www.beirutdc.org/beirutdc/festivals/FilmDetails.aspx?fft_id=114 |title="Nahla" by Farouk Beloufa (1979) |accessdate=2013-01-19 |work=beirutdc}}</ref> It was entered into the [[11th Moscow International Film Festival]] where Yasmine Khlat won the award for Best Actress.<ref name="Moscow1979">{{cite web |url=http://www.moscowfilmfestival.ru/miff34/eng/archives/?year=1979 |title=11th Moscow International Film Festival (1979) |accessdate=2013-01-19 |work=MIFF}}</ref>

==Cast==
* Roger Assaf as Nasri
* Yasmine Khlat as Nahla
* Lina Tebbara as Maha
* Faek Homaissi as Raouf

title: Talk:Sweetener (disambiguation)
content:
{{WikiProject Disambiguation}}
{{WikiProject Food and drink|class=stub|importance=mid}}

==Untitled==
Hey, would it be good form to add the '''®''' symbol to some of these?

-----------

The [[corn syrup]] article links to this one, but according to the definition here, a sweetener has fewer calories than sugar.  Is sugar/corn syrup a type of sweetener or not?  Is it appropriate to say that corn syrup is used to sweeten foods, as the other article does?  Is the definition given here appropriate?  Also, I think this definition is vague in some other ways - fewer calories per what unit?  Per gram?  Per perceived sweetness?  And is the comparison based on sucrose, or fructose, or glucose, or some other sugar?  I think that a better definition might cover anything which makes food taste sweeter, including sugar and things like pear juice, and that a list of sugar-based sweeteners should be added to the article.  But I am no expert!

What about people on low-carbohydrate diets who use sugar substitutes not to reduce calorie intake, but instead carb intake?

Could this article simply be renamed "sugar substitute?"  --[[User:Mcnett|Mcnett]] 23:53, 13 Apr 2004 (UTC)

----

----
:I am making the change -- "sweetener" means "something that adds sweetness", and I don't think anyone could argue that sugar does not add sweetness. In the Oxford dictionary (but not in Webster's), "sweetener" is defined as being "something that sweetens, especially something other than sugar". So it seems this is a Britishism. Even if it is, the current article does not make note of this, so I am moving the "sweetener" article to "sugar substitute" and writing a short stub for "sweetener" which makes mention of the Britishism.
:::[[User:Tooki|Tooki]] 18:59, 10 Jul 2004 (UTC)

:: But the OED strives to be a dictionary of all English dialects, and if a usage is peculiar to some dialect, makes a note of this.  The above is weak evidence. [[User:Shimmin|Shimmin]] 01:12, August 12, 2005 (UTC)

I got here because of the link from a page that listed honey and corn syrup as "Sweeteners"... I guess something should be done about this, obviously many people use "Sweeteners" for things other than "Artificial sweeteners" (and I must add, if there IS a phrase "Artificial sweeteners", that should mean there ARE sweeteners which are NOT artificial). I have made this a stub instead of a redirect, but I wasn't sure what definition to use, so I urge someone smarter than me to do it :) --[[User:Arny|Arny]] 03:39, 26 February 2006 (UTC)

:I have add the MergeTo templete because the article [[Sugar substitute]] is about the same but in much more details. [[User:Kinamand|Kinamand]] ([[User talk:Kinamand|talk]]) 13:56, 28 October 2008 (UTC)

title: Talk:Duratrans
content:
Amen to the other comments here. This article is primarily about a very specific, and I'd bet relatively low volume, use of the material. Which are there more of in the world: news sets, or bus stops? But the whole article is about sets. It's like having the whole article on gold talk specifically about plating the clips on a MontBlanc pen.  <small>—Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/216.158.7.202|216.158.7.202]] ([[User talk:216.158.7.202|talk]]) 20:04, 8 February 2008 (UTC)</small><!-- Template:UnsignedIP --> <!--Autosigned by SineBot-->




I find the definition to be very narrow. Duratrans is a material to start with, THEN a stage design element. I believe the last sentence of the article should be the first.


Duratrans is a Kodak product, which is a backlit film material. This page only refers to one use of Duratrans.
Shouldn't the main point of this page be about the Kodak material, and show it's use in TV sets as an example, rather than the other way around?  <small>—Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/59.167.197.87|59.167.197.87]] ([[User talk:59.167.197.87|talk]]) 03:53, 5 September 2007 (UTC)</small><!-- Template:UnsignedIP --> <!--Autosigned by SineBot-->

title: Christmas Spirituals
content:
{{refimprove|date=September 2014}} {{Infobox album | | Name = Christmas Spirituals | Type = [[studio album]] | Artist = [[Odetta]] | Cover = OdettaChristmasSpirituals.jpg | Released = 1960 | Recorded = [[Carnegie Hall]] | Genre = [[Spiritual (music)|Spirituals]], [[Gospel (music)|Gospel]], [[Christmas music|Christmas]] | Length = 29:06 | Label =[[Vanguard Records|Vanguard]] | Producer = Rachel Faro | Last album = ''[[Odetta at Carnegie Hall]]''
(1960) | This album = '''''Christmas Spirituals'''''
(1960) | Next album = ''[[Odetta and The Blues]]''
(1962) | Misc = {{Extra album cover | Upper caption = Alternative cover | Type = studio album | Cover = OdettaChristmasSpirituals2.jpg | Lower caption = }} }} '''''Christmas Spirituals''''' is the name of two albums recorded by the [[United States|American]] [[folk music|folk singer]] [[Odetta]]. The first was released in 1960 on Vanguard Records. The second, a new recording of mostly the same songs, produced by Rachel Faro at White Crowe Audio in Burlington, Vermont, was originally released in 1987 on Alcazar Records and was reissued digitally in 2007 on Ashe Records. Both albums have [[Bill Lee (musician)|Bill Lee]], [[Spike Lee]]'s father on bass. The cover of the second ''Christmas Spirituals'' album, by the artist Coleen Patterson, depicts a Black Madonna by the River Jordan with the Three Kings in attendance. She{{who|date=October 2011}} says these songs are traditional spirituals that emerged from the sufferings of slavery as a catharsis for the terrible wrongs that were committed. {{Album ratings |rev1 = [[Allmusic]] |rev1score = {{Rating|4.5|5}}[{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r133217|pure_url=yes}} Allmusic review] }} ==1960 track listing== #"Virgin Mary Had One Son" – 2:44 #"Somebody's Talking About Jesus" – 2:49 #"Ain't That A-Rocking" – 2:04 #"Mary Had A Baby" – 1:47 #"[[Go Tell It on the Mountain (song)|Go Tell It On The Mountain]]" – 2:07 #"Beautiful Star" – 2:42 #"Poor Little Jesus" – 2:23 #"Shout For Joy" – 1:42 #"Oh, Jerusalem" – 1:27 #"Rise Up Shepherd And Follow" – 1:49 #"If Anybody Asks You" – 2:35 #"What Month Was Jesus Born In?" – 2:04 #"[[Children, Go Where I Send Thee]]" – 6:59 ==1987 track listing== All songs traditional unless otherwise noted. #"Rise up, Shepherd, and Follow" – 1:45 #"What Month Was Jesus Born In?" – 2:25 #"Mary Had a Baby" – 1:52 #"Somebody Talking 'Bout Jesus" – 2:05 #"Virgin Mary Had One Son" – 3:08 #"[[Go Tell It on the Mountain (song)|Go Tell It on the Mountain]]" – 2:01 #"Shout for Joy" – 2:31 #"Poor Little Jesus" – 1:56 #"O Jerusalem" (with new lyrics by Rachel Faro) – 2:51 #"Ain't That A-Rockin'" – 3:20 #"If Anybody Asks You" (Odetta Gordon) – 2:00 #"Beautiful Star" (Gordon) – 2:54 #"[[Children Go Where I Send Thee]]" – 2:45 ==Personnel== *[[Odetta]] – [[singing|vocals]], [[guitar]] *[[Bill Lee (musician)|Bill Lee]] – [[double bass]] *Lincoln Goines * – [[bass guitar]] *Jeff Salisbury * – [[percussion]], [[drums]] *Carol Steele * – percussion *Helge Sasse * – executive producer ''(* denotes 1987 personnel)'' ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Odetta}} [[Category:1960 Christmas albums]] [[Category:Odetta albums]] [[Category:Vanguard Records albums]] [[Category:Christmas albums by American artists]] [[Category:English-language albums]] [[Category:Covers albums]]

title: File:Solar System XIV.PNG
content:
== Summary == The '''[[Solar System]]''': #The [[Sun]] :''Inner solar system:''
  1. [[Mercury (planet)|Mercury]]
  2. [[Venus]]
  3. [[Earth]] & its moon, [[Moon|Luna]]
  4. [[Mars]] & its moons, [[Phobos (moon)|Phobos]] & [[Deimos (moon)|Deimos]]
  5. The [[asteroid belt]], including [[Ceres (dwarf planet)|Ceres]]
:''Middle solar system:''
  1. [[Jupiter]] & its [[planemo]] moons, [[Io (moon)|Io]], [[Europa (moon)|Europa]], [[Ganymede (moon)|Ganymede]] & [[Callisto (moon)|Callisto]]
  2. [[Saturn]] & its planemo moons, [[Mimas (moon)|Mimas]], [[Enceladus (moon)|Enceladus]], [[Tethys (moon)|Tethys]], [[Dione (moon)|Dione]], [[Rhea (moon)|Rhea]], [[Titan (moon)|Titan]] & [[Iapetus (moon)|Iapetus]]
  3. [[Uranus]] & its planemo moons, [[Miranda (moon)|Miranda]], [[Ariel (moon)|Ariel]], [[Umbriel (moon)|Umbriel]], [[Titania (moon)|Titania]] & [[Oberon (moon)|Oberon]]
  4. [[Neptune]] & its planemo moon, [[Triton (moon)|Triton]]
:''Outer solar system:''
  1. The [[Kuiper belt]], including [[Pluto]] and its moon, [[Charon (moon)|Charon]]
  2. The [[scattered disc]], including [[Eris (dwarf planet)|Eris]] and its moon, [[Dysnomia (moon)|Dysnomia]]
  3. The [[Oort cloud]]
== Licensing == {{PD-user|The Enlightened|date=May 2007}} {{Copy to Wikimedia Commons|bot=Fbot}}

'''Dear {{PAGENAME}}''',

'''[[Wikipedia:Welcome, newcomers|Welcome]]''' to '''[[Wikipedia]]'''!

Unfortunately, using your [[e-mail address]] as your [[Wikipedia:Username|username]] is not a good idea. Wikipedia content is extensively copied and the site itself is one of the most visited sites in the world. Any edit you make on Wikipedia will have your username attached to it, and using your email address will make you a tempting target for [[E-mail spam|spammers]]. We recommend that you change your username at [[Wikipedia:Changing username]] in order to prevent abuse.

If you need any help, simply contact me on my talk page, or go to [[Wikipedia:Help desk]]. Another option is to place {{tl|helpme}} on your own talk page, and someone will come shortly to help. Remember to [[Wikipedia:Sign your posts on talk pages|sign]] your posts on talk pages with four tildes (~~~~). Again, welcome!

- [[User talk:(aeropagitica)|''' (aeropagitica) ''''''  (talk) ''']] at {{CURRENTDATE}}

title: Autocrat
content:
An '''autocrat''' is the ruler of an autocracy, but the term may also refer to:

* [[Autocracy]], a system of government in which one person has absolute power and is unaccountable to the law or the citizenry
* [[Auster Autocrat]], a 1940s British single-engined three-seat high-wing touring monoplane
* [[Autocrat, LLC]], a company based in Rhode Island, United States
* ''[[The Autocrat of the Breakfast-Table]]'', a collection of essays written by Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.
* [[The Autocrats]], a Finnish political satire TV series
* [[Autokrator]], a Greek epithet applied to an individual who exercises absolute power, unrestrained by superiors

{{disambiguation}}

title: User talk:Zorbis~enwiki
content:
== Your account will be renamed ==
Hello, The developer team at Wikimedia is making some changes to how accounts work, as part of our on-going efforts to provide new and better tools for our users like cross-wiki notifications. These changes will mean you have the same account name everywhere. This will let us give you new features that will help you edit and discuss better, and allow more flexible user permissions for tools. One of the side-effects of this is that user accounts will now have to be unique across all 900 Wikimedia wikis. See [[m:Special:MyLanguage/Single User Login finalisation announcement|the announcement]] for more information. Unfortunately, your account clashes with another account also called Zorbis. To make sure that both of you can use all Wikimedia projects in future, we have reserved the name Zorbis~enwiki that only you will have. If you like it, you don't have to do anything. If you do not like it, you can [[Special:GlobalRenameRequest|pick out a different name]]. If you think you might own all of the accounts with this name and this message is in error, please visit [[Special:MergeAccount]] to check and attach all of your accounts to prevent them from being renamed. Your account will still work as before, and you will be credited for all your edits made so far, but you will have to use the new account name when you log in. Sorry for the inconvenience. Yours,
[[m:User:Keegan (WMF)|Keegan Peterzell]]
Community Liaison, Wikimedia Foundation
03:34, 20 March 2015 (UTC) == Renamed ==

title: User:Keng130/Cirsium lecontei
content:
{{Italic title}}{{Taxobox | name = ''Circsium lecontei''
Le Conte's thistle | image = | regnum = [[Plant]]ae | divisio = [[Flowering plant|Magnoliophyta]] |unranked_classis = [[Dicot]] | classis = [[Magnoliopsida]] | ordo = [[Asterales]] | familia = [[Asteraceae]] | genus = ''[[Cirsium]]'' | species = '''''C. lecontei''''' | binomial = ''Cirsium lecontei'' | binomial_authority = [[Torr. & Gray]]http://www.invasive.org/browse/subinfo.cfm?sub=12917 }} '''''Cirsium lecontei''''' (often called the '''Le Conte's thistle''') is a species of thistle that is part of the [[Asteraceae]] family. ''Cirsium lecontei'' is a forb/herb of the genus Cirsium. A forb/herb is a non-woody plant that is not a grass.[http://plantdatabase.co.za/Cirsium_lecontei plant databade plantdatabase-cirsium lecontei] It’s duration is perennial, which means it will grow year after year. It sometimes appears biennial. They flower spring to summer (May-Aug). {{aut|Keil, David J. & Ochsmann, J.}} (2006): 24. ''Cirsium lecontei. In: [[Flora of North America North of Mexico]]'' Vol. 19 (Magnoliophyta: Asteridae, part 6: Asteraceae, part 1). Oxford University Press. ISBN 0195305639 [http://www.efloras.org/florataxon.aspx?flora_id=1&taxon_id=250066381 HTML fulltext] ==Description== They grow to be 35-110 cm and have taproots, sometimes with root sprouts.{{aut|Keil, David J. & Ochsmann, J.}} (2006): 24. ''Cirsium lecontei. In: [[Flora of North America North of Mexico]]'' Vol. 19 (Magnoliophyta: Asteridae, part 6: Asteraceae, part 1). Oxford University Press. ISBN 0195305639 [http://www.efloras.org/florataxon.aspx?flora_id=1&taxon_id=250066381 HTML fulltext] The plant has spines or sharp edges and should be handled with extreme caution. When they bloom, they are usually pale pink or pink in color. Full sun exposure is needed in order for growth to take place. Le Conte's Thistle has a National Wetland Indicator Status of FACW-usually occurs in wetlands. [http://davesgarden.com/guides/pf/go/97888/ davesgarden-Le Contes thistle] The stems are loosely arachnoid and stiffly ascending. Leaves have blades that are linear to oblong or narrowly elliptic, lobes undivided or coarsely few toothed, loosely arachnoid when young, abaxial and adaxial faces glabrous; basal sometimes absent at flowering, petiolate. Heads born singly or less common in open corymbiform arrays. Penduncles are 5-30 cm elevated above cauline leaves. Cypselae is light brown in color, 5-5.75mm.[boof ref] Plants are often unbranched or sparingly branched, with single terminal flower heads that are above the foliage(plant leaves). Stem and lower leaf surfaces have cob webby hairs. With age, the plant starts loosing the hairs and becoming glabrous(hairless,smooth). Mid-stem leaves are approximately 15 cm long, pinnately lobed, and the leaves gradually reduced in size up the stem. Corollas are pinkish-purple with feather-like pappus bristles (modified sepals).[http://docs.google.com/a/students.ncc.edu/viewer?a=v&q=cache:u9nGak-tF6oJ:www.wlf.louisiana.gov/sites/default/files/pdf/fact_sheet_plant/31794-Cirsium%2520lecontei/cirsium_lecontei.pdf+cirsum+lecontei&hl=en&gl=us&pid=bl&srcid=ADGEEShXRaygFQKffzYFiExt9VmpmoeE4xV5W-FEqaV5hr06Oco8hxQCRsugO_Q00eFF74NBweFBU4xa1bvIvroV8BWVrYK4nTcbbI1X9W9gqgoaOUd57belPj9mieL5fmIjilvgw-Db&sig=AHIEtbQwPS-5xud5CSFnGIhmjfe7D9chxQ googledoc-cirsium lecontei] ==Distribution== ''Cirsium lecontei'' or Le Conte's thistle's floral region is native in North America. They occur on the sandy pinelands of southern coastal plain in damp soil(where co-occurring species include Myrica, Cyrilla, and Ilex)[BOOF REF], specifically in the states of Alabama, Florida, Georgia, Louisiana, Mississippi, North Carolina and South Carolina. They are also found in grassy (often moist to wet) pine savannahs and pine barrens, bogs (where co-occurring species include pitcher plants, Ilex, sedges, grasses, and sphagnum), and roadside ditches.[http://www.natureserve.org/explorer/servlet/NatureServe?sourceTemplate=tabular_report.wmt&loadTemplate=species_RptComprehensive.wmt&selectedReport=RptComprehensive.wmt&summaryView=tabular_report.wmt&elKey=158669&paging=home&save=true&startIndex=1&nextStartIndex=1&reset=false&offPageSelectedElKey=158669&offPageSelectedElType=species&offPageYesNo=true&post_processes=&radiobutton=radiobutton&selectedIndexes=158669 naturereserve-LeContes thistle] ==Threats== ''Cirsium lecontei'' occurs mostly in North Carolina but even there it appears to be rare. It's presence is also rare from South Carolina south to Florida and west to Louisiana. Thus, populations tend to be very small and can be as small as one individual.[http://www.natureserve.org/explorer/servlet/NatureServe?sourceTemplate=tabular_report.wmt&loadTemplate=species_RptComprehensive.wmt&selectedReport=RptComprehensive.wmt&summaryView=tabular_report.wmt&elKey=158669&paging=home&save=true&startIndex=1&nextStartIndex=1&reset=false&offPageSelectedElKey=158669&offPageSelectedElType=species&offPageYesNo=true&post_processes=&radiobutton=radiobutton&selectedIndexes=158669 naturereserve-LeContes thistle] The probable cause decreasing presence of these species are conversion of habitat to pine plantation which may include site prep activities such as bedding and herbicides),inappropriate fire timing, and commercial and residential development.[http://docs.google.com/a/students.ncc.edu/viewer?a=v&q=cache:u9nGak-tF6oJ:www.wlf.louisiana.gov/sites/default/files/pdf/fact_sheet_plant/31794-Cirsium%2520lecontei/cirsium_lecontei.pdf+cirsum+lecontei&hl=en&gl=us&pid=bl&srcid=ADGEEShXRaygFQKffzYFiExt9VmpmoeE4xV5W-FEqaV5hr06Oco8hxQCRsugO_Q00eFF74NBweFBU4xa1bvIvroV8BWVrYK4nTcbbI1X9W9gqgoaOUd57belPj9mieL5fmIjilvgw-Db&sig=AHIEtbQwPS-5xud5CSFnGIhmjfe7D9chxQ googledoc-cirsium lecontei] ==Hypotheses== R.J.Moore and C. Frankton(1969) suggested that it originated as a product of ancient hybridizaton between the ancestors of ''C. horridulum'' and ''C. nuttallii''. They also suggested a relationship between ''C. lecontei'' and ''C. grahamii'' of Arizona and hypothesized an ancient dispersal from the southeastern coastal plain to western cordillera. {{aut|Keil, David J. & Ochsmann, J.}} (2006): 24. ''Cirsium lecontei. In: [[Flora of North America North of Mexico]]'' Vol. 19 (Magnoliophyta: Asteridae, part 6: Asteraceae, part 1). Oxford University Press. ISBN 0195305639 [http://www.efloras.org/florataxon.aspx?flora_id=1&taxon_id=250066381 HTML fulltext] ==References== {{Reflist}}

content:

{{MedalBottom}}

'''Michael Fagan''' (born November 4, 1980 in [[Westbury, New York]]) is an American professional [[Ten-pin bowling|bowler]] on the [[PBA Tour]]. He has also participated in World Bowling Tour (WBT) and European Bowling Tour (EBT) events, and as a member of Team USA in international competitions. Known for his high backswing, he is sometimes known as the "King of Swing". He has a high RPM rate, but also has a smooth release, so his style can be classified as either a [[cranker]] or a [[power stroker]].

==PBA Career==

Fagan began his PBA career in the 2002{{ndash}}03 season, and owns five PBA Tour titles, including two majors. He captured his first PBA title in his 108th career event, winning the PBA Exempt Doubles Classic with partner [[Danny Wiseman]] in the 2007{{ndash}}08 season. He earned his first singles title at the 2010 One-a-Day [[Dick Weber]] Open, defeating all-time titles leader [[Walter Ray Williams, Jr.]] in the final match.

His next victory came at the 2012 Brunswick Euro Challenge, a World Bowling Tour event, where he was credited with his third PBA Title. Having lost to [[Chris Barnes (bowler)|Chris Barnes]] in his first TV appearance at the semifinals of the 2003 Empire State Open in [[Latham, New York]], Fagan got his revenge on Barnes in the 2012 [[USBC Masters]], overcoming a 30-pin deficit after five frames to win his fourth title and first major championship.<ref>Vint, Bill. "Mike Fagan Tops Chris Barnes to Win First Major Title in Alka Seltzer Plus Liquid Gels USBC Masters." Article at www.pba.com on January 29, 2012. [http://news.pba.com/post/2012/1/29/Mike-Fagan-Tops-Chris-Barnes-to-Win-First-Major-Title-in-Alka-Seltzer-Plus-Liquid-Gels-USBC-Masters.aspx]</ref> Fagan narrowly missed winning a second consecutive major in that season's [[U.S. Open (bowling)|U.S. Open]], when [[Pete Weber]] rolled a strike on his final ball of the tenth frame to defeat Fagan, 215–214.<ref>Vint, Bill. "Pete Weber Wins Record Fifth U.S. Open to Surpass Father Dick Weber and Don Carter." Article at www.pba.com on February 26, 2012. [http://news.pba.com/post/2012/2/26/Pete-Weber-Wins-Record-Fifth-US-Open-to-Surpass-Father-Dick-Weber-and-Don-Carter.aspx]</ref> Marking his first (and so far only) season with multiple titles, Fagan won a career-high $116,950 in 2011{{ndash}}12.

Fagan won his fifth career title and second major at the [[PBA World Championship]] on January 11, 2015, defeating [[Wes Malott]] in the final match, 252–212.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.pba.com/post/2015/1/11/Mike-Fagan-Wins-PBA-World-Championship-for-Fifth-Tour-Title-and-Second-Major.aspx |title=Mike Fagan Wins PBA World Championship for Fifth Tour Title and Second Major |last=Schneider |first=Jerry |publisher=PBA.com |date=January 11, 2015 |accessdate=January 12, 2015}}</ref>

==Other career highlights==
* Prior to 2012, Fagan's best finish at a major was third place at the 2006 [[U.S. Open (bowling)|U.S. Open]].  He defeated 2000 U.S. Open champion [[Robert Smith (bowler)|Robert Smith]], 216–214, in the first match of the finals (his first career match win on TV) before losing to [[Tommy Jones (bowler)|Tommy Jones]].
* Had a career-high four [[Perfect game (bowling)|perfect 300 games]] during the 2007-08 season, tied for second on Tour.  Through the 2015 season, he has racked up 21 perfect games in PBA events.
* His career PBA Tour earnings are over $870,000 (through 2015). He also owns two PBA Regional titles.<ref>[http://www.pba.com/Bowlers/Bowler/1713 PBA Tour Bowlers bio] at www.pba.com</ref>
* Was the victim of [[Liz Johnson (bowler)|Liz Johnson]] in the finals of the 2005 East Region Kingpin Lanes tournament, the first PBA tournament ever won by a female bowler.
* Lost to Jack Jurek in a sudden death rolloff in the 2009 Shark Championship, giving Jurek his first title in 14 years.
* Has won five European Bowling Tour (EBT) titles as of April 30, 2012.<ref>"Mike Fagan wins his fifth career EBT title in 3rd Track Dream-Bowl Palace Open." Article at bowlingdigital.com on April 30, 2012. [http://www.bowlingdigital.com/bowl/node/10865]</ref>
* He is a five-time member of Team USA.
* Fagan also serves as PBA Player Committee Chairman and is on the [[United States Bowling Congress|USBC]] Board of Directors.

==Personal==
Originally from [[Patchogue, New York]], Fagan now resides in [[Fort Worth, Texas]] with his wife, Emily, whom he married in 2013.  Mike, who got his undergraduate degree in Finance at [[St. John's University (New York City)|St. John's University]], announced during the 2015 season that he would be reducing his appearances on the PBA Tour to pursue his [[MBA]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.stormbowling.com/athlete/national/mfagan |title=Mike Fagan (bowler profile at StormBowling.com) |publisher=StormBowling.com |accessdate=February 22, 2016}}</ref>

title: New Recreation Ground
content:
{{Use dmy dates|date=March 2012}} {{ infobox stadium | name = New Recreation Ground | nickname = The Rec, New Rec, Bridge Road | image = [[Image:The New Rec - Main Stand and Dugouts.jpg|250px]] | fullname = | location = [[Grays]], [[Essex]], [[England]] | coordinates = {{coord|51|28|35.57|N|0|19|46.86|E}} | broke_ground = | built = | opened = | renovated = 2004 | expanded = | closed = 2010 | demolished = 2010 | owner = The Billings Family | operator = | surface = Grass | construction_cost = | architect = | structural engineer = | services engineer = | general_contractor = | project_manager = | main_contractors = | former_names = Recreation Ground | tenants = [[Grays United F.C.|Grays United]] (until 1906)
[[Grays Athletic F.C.|Grays Athletic]] (1906–2010) | capacity = 4,100 (1,000 seated) | record_attendance = 9,500 | dimensions = | scoreboard = }} The '''New Recreation Ground''' was a football stadium on Bridge Road, [[Grays]], [[Essex]], [[England]], and was the home ground of [[Grays Athletic F.C.|Grays Athletic]]. Prior to it being closed, the capacity stood at 4,100, of which 1,000 was seated. Grays Athletic moved to the ground, originally known as the '''Recreation Ground''' in 1906. Previously the ground had been home to [[Southern Football League|Southern League]] club [[Grays United F.C.|Grays United]], but they had merged into Athletic. The record attendance of 9,500 was set in 1959 during an [[FA Cup]] tie with [[Chelmsford City F.C.|Chelmsford City]]. In 1981 the Club Patron, Mr. Ron Billings, ensured the future of Grays Athletic at the Rec by purchasing the ground. The ground was redeveloped at the beginning of the [[2004–05 Football Conference|2004–05 season]] in order to meet the standards set by the [[Football Conference]], and was renamed the New Recreation Ground, often nicknamed The New Rec. Below the bar area was an indoor 5-a-side [[AstroTurf]] pitch. This was hired out to the public and also hosts various community schemes. After the death of Ron Billings, the club was unable to negotiate viable terms for a new lease with the Billings family, and the ground was redeveloped for housing. Grays Athletic had planned to move to a new stadium, but at the end of the [[2009–10 Grays Athletic F.C. season|2009–10]] season announced they would groundshare at [[East Thurrock United F.C.|East Thurrock United]]'s Rookery Hill.{{ cite news | url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/g/grays_athletic/8747465.stm | title = Grays Athletic win Ryman League appeal | publisher = BBC Sport | date = 18 June 2010 | accessdate =21 June 2010 }} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://graysathletic.co.uk/visitors/ Information For Visitors] Grays Athletic {{coord|51|28|35.57|N|0|19|46.86|E|region:GB_type:landmark|display=title}} [[Category:Defunct football venues in England]] [[Category:Sports venues in Thurrock]] [[Category:Grays Athletic F.C.]] {{England-sports-venue-stub}}
