title: User talk:2.51.158.209
content: == December 2011 == [[Image:Information.svg|left|25px|alt=|link=]] Hello, and welcome to Wikipedia. Everyone is welcome to make constructive contributions to Wikipedia, but at least one of your recent edits, such as the one you made to [[:List of glossing abbreviations]], did not appear to be constructive and has been '''automatically [[Help:Reverting|reverted]]''' (undone) by an [[automated]] [[computer program]] called [[User:ClueBot NG|ClueBot NG]]. * Please use [[Wikipedia:Sandbox|the sandbox]] for any test edits you would like to make, and take a look at the [[Wikipedia:Introduction|welcome page]] to learn more about contributing to this encyclopedia. Note that human editors do monitor recent changes to Wikipedia articles, and [[WP:ADMINS|administrators]] have the ability to [[WP:BLOCK|block]] users from editing if they repeatedly engage in [[WP:vandalism|vandalism]]. * ClueBot NG makes very few [[User:ClueBot NG#Information About False Positives|mistakes]], but it does happen. content:
==Welcome== {| style="border-spacing:8px;margin:0px -8px" width="100%" |class="MainPageBG" style="width: 55%; border:1px solid #084080; background-color:#F5FFFA; vertical-align:top;color:#000000;font-size: 85%"| {| width="100%" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="5" style="vertical-align:top; background-color:#F5FFFA" !
Hello 86.138.232.74, and [[Wikipedia:Welcome, newcomers|welcome]] to Wikipedia! Here are some recommended guidelines to help you get involved. Please feel free to contact me if you need help with anything. Best of luck and happy editing! [[User:Charlesknight|Charlesknight]] 09:26, 1 July 2006 (UTC)
|} {| style="border-spacing:8px;margin:0px -8px" width="100%" |class="MainPageBG" style="width: 55%; border:1px solid #FFFFFF; background-color:#F5FFFA; vertical-align:top"| {| width="100%" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="5" style="vertical-align:top; background-color:#F5FFFA" !
Getting started
|- |style="color:#000"| * [[Wikipedia:Tutorial|Wikipedia Tutorial]] * [[Wikipedia:How to edit a page|How to edit a page]] * [[Wikipedia:Five pillars|The five pillars of Wikipedia]] * [[Wikipedia:Manual of Style|Manual of Style]] * [[Wikipedia:Be bold in updating pages|Be bold in editing]] * [[Wikipedia:How to write a great article|How to write a great article]] * [[Wikipedia:List of WikiProjects|WikiProjects]] |- !
Getting your info out there
|- | style="color:#000"| * [[Wikipedia:Cite your sources|Cite your sources]] * [[Wikipedia:NPOV|Neutral Point of View]] * [[Wikipedia:POV|Point of View]] * [[Wikipedia:Verifiability|Verifiability]] * [[Wikipedia:Uploading images|Uploading images]] * [[Wikipedia:Image use policy|Image use policy]] |- !
Getting more Wikipedia rules
|- | style="color:#000"| * [[Wikipedia:List of policies|Policy Library]] |- |} |class="MainPageBG" style="width: 55%; border:1px solid #FFFFFF; background-color:#F5FFFA; vertical-align:top"| {| width="100%" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="5" style="vertical-align:top; background-color:#F5FFFA" !
Getting help
|- |style="color:#000"| * [[Wikipedia:New contributors' help page|New contributors' help page]] * [[Wikipedia:Where to ask a question|Where to ask a question]] * [[Wikipedia:Help desk|Help Desk]] * [[Wikipedia:FAQ|Frequently Asked Questions]] |- !
Getting along
|- |style="color:#000"| * [[Wikipedia:Wikipedians|Wikipedians]] * [[Wikipedia:Wikiquette|Wikiquette]] * [[Wikipedia:Civility|Civility]] * [[Wikipedia:Sign your posts on talk pages|Sign your posts]] * [[Wikipedia:Conflict resolution|Conflict resolution]] |- !
Getting technical
|- |style="color:#000"| [[Image:Wikimedia.png|60px|right]] * [[Wikipedia:Pages needing attention|Pages needing attention]] * [[Wikipedia:Peer review|Peer review]] * [[Wikipedia:Utilities|Utilities]] * [[Wikipedia:Village pump|Village pump]] |- |} |} |} == Fender == Change it again and you should be OK - that was me a bit quick off the draw I thought you were trying to change it to a magazine link! :) Also handy if you get an account then people can leave messages and the like. --[[User:Charlesknight|Charlesknight]] 09:34, 1 July 2006 (UTC)

title: User talk:Sector311
content:
'''Welcome!''' Hello, {{BASEPAGENAME}}, and [[Wikipedia:Introduction|welcome]] to Wikipedia! Thank you for [[Special:Contributions/{{BASEPAGENAME}}|your contributions]]{{#if:|, especially what you did for [[{{{art}}}]]|}}. I hope you like the place and decide to stay. Here are some pages that you might find helpful: *[[Wikipedia:Five pillars|The five pillars of Wikipedia]] *[[Wikipedia:Tutorial|Tutorial]] *[[Wikipedia:How to edit a page|How to edit a page]] *[[Wikipedia:Article development|How to write a great article]] *[[Wikipedia:Manual of Style|Manual of Style]] I hope you enjoy editing here and being a [[Wikipedia:Wikipedians|Wikipedian]]! Please [[Wikipedia:Signatures|sign]] your messages on [[Wikipedia:talk page|discussion page]]s using four [[tilde]]s (~~~~); this will automatically insert your username and the date. If you need help, check out [[Wikipedia:Questions]], ask me on {{#if:|[[user talk:{{{1}}}|my talk page]]|my talk page}}, or ask your question and then place {{helpme}} before the question on your talk page. Again, welcome! --[[User:Muchness|Muchness]] ([[User talk:Muchness|talk]]) 15:00, 9 March 2008 (UTC) ==Fair use rationale for [[:Image:The unveiling.jpg]]== Thanks for uploading or contributing to '''[[:Image:The unveiling.jpg]]'''. I notice the image page specifies that the image is being used under [[Wikipedia:Fair use|fair use]] but there is not a suitable explanation or rationale as to why each specific use in Wikipedia constitutes fair use. Please go to [[:Image:The unveiling.jpg|the image description page]] and edit it to include a [[Wikipedia:Non-free use rationale guideline|fair use rationale]]. If you have uploaded other fair use media, consider checking that you have specified the fair use rationale on those pages too. You can find a list of 'image' pages you have edited by clicking on the "[[Special:Contributions/{{PAGENAME}}|my contributions]]" link (it is located at the very top of any Wikipedia page when you are logged in), and then selecting "Image" from the dropdown box. Note that any non-free media lacking such an explanation will be deleted one week after they have been uploaded, as described on [[Wikipedia:Criteria for speedy deletion#Images.2FMedia|criteria for speedy deletion]]. If you have any questions please ask them at the [[Wikipedia:media copyright questions|Media copyright questions page]]. Thank you. NOTE: once you correct this, please remove the tag from the image's page. [[User:STBotI|STBotI]] ([[User talk:STBotI|talk]]) 14:57, 9 March 2008 (UTC) :Another image you uploaded, [[:Image:Project86.JPG]], is also missing a fair use rationale. --[[User:Muchness|Muchness]] ([[User talk:Muchness|talk]]) 15:00, 9 March 2008 (UTC) ==Orphaned non-free media (Image:The unveiling.jpg)== [[Image:Nuvola apps important blue.svg|25px]] Thanks for uploading '''[[:Image:The unveiling.jpg]]'''. The media description page currently specifies that it is non-free and may only be used on Wikipedia under a [[WP:FU|claim of fair use]]. However, it is currently [[Wikipedia:Orphan|orphaned]], meaning that it is not used in any articles on Wikipedia. If the media was previously in an article, please go to the article and see why it was removed. [[WP:BOLD|You may add it back]] if you think that that will be useful. However, please note that media for which a replacement could be created are not acceptable for use on Wikipedia (see [[Wikipedia:Non-free content#Policy|our policy for non-free media]]). If you have uploaded other unlicensed media, please check whether they're used in any articles or not. You can find a list of 'image' pages you have edited by clicking on the "[[Special:Contributions/{{PAGENAME}}|my contributions]]" link (it is located at the very top of any Wikipedia page when you are logged in), and then selecting "Image" from the dropdown box. Note that all non-free media not used in any '''articles''' will be deleted after seven days, as described on [[wikipedia:Criteria for speedy deletion#Images.2FMedia|criteria for speedy deletion]]. Thank you. [[User:BJBot|BJBot]] ([[User talk:BJBot|talk]]) 06:51, 12 March 2008 (UTC) ==Speedy deletion of [[:Image:Project86promo.jpg]]== [[Image:Nuvola apps important.svg|48px|left]] A tag has been placed on [[:Image:Project86promo.jpg]] requesting that it be speedily deleted from Wikipedia. This has been done under [[WP:CSD#I1|section I1 of the criteria for speedy deletion]], because the image is redundant copy (all pixels the same or scaled down) of an image in the same file format, which is on Wikipedia (not on Commons), and all inward links have been updated. If you think that this notice was placed here in error, you may contest the deletion by adding {{tl|hangon}} to '''the top of [[:Image:Project86promo.jpg|the page]]''' (just below the existing speedy deletion or "db" tag), coupled with adding a note on '''[[ Talk:Image:Project86promo.jpg|the talk page]]''' explaining your position, but be aware that once tagged for ''speedy'' deletion, if the article meets the criterion it may be deleted without delay. Please do not remove the speedy deletion tag yourself, but don't hesitate to add information to the article that would would render it more in conformance with Wikipedia's policies and guidelines. {{#ifeq: No|No||Lastly, please note that if the article does get deleted, you can contact [[:Category:Wikipedia administrators who will provide copies of deleted articles|one of these admins]] to request that a copy be emailed to you.}} [[User:Polly|Polly]] ([[User talk:Polly|Parrot]]) 20:44, 24 March 2008 (UTC) ==Fair use rationale for [[:Image:Project86-1-.jpg]]== Thanks for uploading or contributing to '''[[:Image:Project86-1-.jpg]]'''. I notice the image page specifies that the image is being used under [[Wikipedia:Fair use|fair use]] but there is not a suitable explanation or rationale as to why each specific use in Wikipedia constitutes fair use. If you have any questions please ask them at the [[Wikipedia:media copyright questions|Media copyright questions page]]. Thank you. [[User:Polly|Polly]] ([[User talk:Polly|Parrot]]) 20:45, 24 March 2008 (UTC) ==Repost of [[:Steven Dail]]== [[Image:Nuvola apps important.svg|left|48px|]]A tag has been placed on {{#if:Steven Dail|[[:Steven Dail]]|an article you created}}, requesting that it be speedily deleted from Wikipedia. This has been done because the article appears to be a repost of material that was previously deleted following a {{#if:|discussion at [[:{{{2}}}]]|[[Wikipedia:Deletion debates|deletion debate]], such as [[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion|articles for deletion]]}}. If you can indicate how Steven Dail is different from the previously posted material, or if you can indicate why this article should not be deleted, I advise you to place the template {{tl|hangon}} '''underneath''' the other template on the article, and also put a note on [[Talk:Steven Dail]] saying why this article should stay. An admin should check for such edits before deleting the article. Feel free to leave a note on my talk page if you have any questions about this. Please read our [[Wikipedia:Criteria for speedy deletion|criteria for speedy deletion]], particularly [[WP:CSD#G4|item 4 under General criteria]]. If you believe the original discussion was unjustified, please feel free to use [[WP:DRV|deletion review]], but do not continue to repost the article if it is deleted. Please do not remove the speedy deletion tag yourself. We welcome your help in trying to improve Wikipedia, and we request you to follow these instructions. [[User:EMT1871|EMT1871]] ([[User talk:EMT1871|talk]]) 15:13, 2 April 2008 (UTC) [[Image:Information.svg|25px]] Please refrain from making unconstructive edits to Wikipedia{{#if:|, as you did to [[:{{{1}}}]]}}. If you would like to experiment, please use the [[Wikipedia:Sandbox|sandbox]]. {{#if:|{{{2}}}|Thank you.}} ==AfD nomination of Steven Dail== I have nominated [[Steven Dail]], an article you created, for [[Wikipedia:Deletion policy|deletion]]. I do not feel that this article satisfies Wikipedia's criteria for inclusion, and have explained why at [[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Steven Dail]]. If you continue, you '''will''' be [[Wikipedia:Blocking policy|blocked]] from editing Wikipedia. {{#if:|{{{2}}}|}} [[User:Asenine|αѕєηιηє]] [[User talk:Asenine|t]]/[[Special:Contributions/Asenine|c]] 15:27, 2 April 2008 (UTC) ==Speedy deletion of [[:Image:Project86-1-.jpg]]== [[Image:Nuvola apps important.svg|48px|left]] A tag has been placed on [[:Image:Project86-1-.jpg]] requesting that it be speedily deleted from Wikipedia. This has been done under [[WP:CSD#I6|section I6 of the criteria for speedy deletion]], because it is a [[Wikipedia:Non-free content|non-free]] image with no [[Wikipedia:Non-free use rationale guideline|fair use rationale]] uploaded after [[May 4]], [[2006]] which has been tagged as not having a rationale for more than 7 days. Please do not remove the speedy deletion tag yourself, but don't hesitate to add information to the article that would would render it more in conformance with Wikipedia's policies and guidelines. {{#ifeq: No|No||Lastly, please note that if the article does get deleted, you can contact [[:Category:Wikipedia administrators who will provide copies of deleted articles|one of these admins]] to request that a copy be emailed to you.}} [[User:Asenine|αѕєηιηє]] [[User talk:Asenine|t]]/[[Special:Contributions/Asenine|c]] 15:27, 2 April 2008 (UTC) == Replaceable fair use Image:PromoProject86.JPG == [[Image:Nuvola apps important.svg|32px|left|Replaceable fair use]] Thanks for uploading '''[[:Image:PromoProject86.JPG]]'''. I noticed the description page specifies that the media is being used under a claim of [[Wikipedia:Non-free content|fair use]], but its use in Wikipedia articles fails our [[Wikipedia:Non-free content criteria|first non-free content criterion]] in that it illustrates a subject for which a freely licensed media could reasonably be found or created that provides substantially the same information. If you believe this media is not replaceable, please: # Go to [[:Image:PromoProject86.JPG|the media description page]] and edit it to add {{tlx|di-replaceable fair use disputed}}, '''without deleting the original replaceable fair use template'''. # On [[Image talk:PromoProject86.JPG|the image discussion page]], write the reason why this image is not replaceable at all. If you have uploaded other non-free media, consider checking that you have specified how these images fully satisfy our non-free content criteria. [[User:J Milburn|J Milburn]] ([[User talk:J Milburn|talk]]) 15:43, 12 June 2008 (UTC) == Replaceable fair use Image:DTaylor.JPG == [[Image:Ambox warning.svg|32px|left|Replaceable fair use]] Thanks for uploading '''[[:Image:DTaylor.JPG]]'''. I noticed the description page specifies that the media is being used under a claim of [[Wikipedia:Non-free content|fair use]], but its use in Wikipedia articles fails our [[Wikipedia:Non-free content criteria|first non-free content criterion]] in that it illustrates a subject for which a freely licensed media could reasonably be found or created that provides substantially the same information. If you believe this media is not replaceable, please: # Go to [[:Image:DTaylor.JPG|the media description page]] and edit it to add {{tlx|di-replaceable fair use disputed}}, '''without deleting the original replaceable fair use template'''. # On [[Image talk:DTaylor.JPG|the image discussion page]], write the reason why this image is not replaceable at all. Alternatively, you can also choose to replace this non-free media by finding freely licensed media of the same subject, [[Wikipedia:Requesting copyright permission|requesting that the copyright holder release this (or similar) media under a free license]], or by taking a picture of it yourself. If you have uploaded other non-free media, consider checking that you have specified how these images fully satisfy our non-free content criteria. You can find a list of description pages you have edited by clicking on [{{fullurl:Special:Contributions|target={{PAGENAMEE}}&namespace=6}} this link]. Note that even if you follow steps 1 and 2 above, non-free media which could be replaced by freely licensed alternatives will be deleted 2 days after this notification (7 days if uploaded before [[13 July]] [[2006]]), per our [[Wikipedia:Non-free content criteria|non-free content policy]]. If you have any questions please ask them at the [[Wikipedia:Media copyright questions|Media copyright questions page]]. Thank you. Do you want to [[Template:Bots#Message notification opt out|opt out]] of receiving this notice? [[User:BlueAzure|BlueAzure]] ([[User talk:BlueAzure|talk]]) 00:37, 20 June 2008 (UTC) == July 2008 == [[Image:Nuvola apps important.svg|25px]] When adding links to material on an external site{{#if:|, as you did to [[:{{{1}}}]]}}, please ensure that the external site is not [[Wikipedia:Copyrights#Linking_to_copyrighted_works|violating the creator's copyright]]. Linking to websites that display copyrighted works is acceptable as long as the website's operator has created or licensed the work. Knowingly directing others to a site that violates copyright may be considered contributory infringement. This is particularly relevant when linking to sites such as [[YouTube]], where due care should be taken to avoid linking to material that violates its creator's copyright. Wikipedia takes copyright violations very seriously, and persistent violators will be [[Wikipedia:Blocking policy|blocked]] from editing.{{#if:|
If you believe the linked site is ''not'' violating copyright with respect to the material, then you should do one of the following: :*If the linked site is the copyright holder, leave a message explaining the details on the article [[Talk:{{{1}}}|Talk page]]; :*If a note on the linked site credibly claims permission to host the material, or a note on the copyright holder's site grants such permission, leave a note on the article [[Talk:{{{1}}}|Talk page]] with a link to where we can find that note; :*If you are the copyright holder or the external site administrator, adjust the linked site to indicate permission as above and leave a note on the article [[Talk:{{{1}}}|Talk page]]; If the material is available on a different site that satisfies one of the above conditions, link to that site instead.}} {{#if:|{{{2}}}|}} [[User:Sfan00 IMG|Sfan00 IMG]] ([[User talk:Sfan00 IMG|talk]]) 18:17, 5 July 2008 (UTC) == You Tube == As you are probably aware, You Tube has recently come under fire in respect of its use of copyrighted works, because of this a review of You Tube linking from enwiki is under way. It is noted that you linked to a number of You Tube videos from your user page. Sadly the (C) status for some of those video is doubtful or unclear. In general linking to material whose (C) Status is ambiguous, unclear or unconfirmed is highly discouraged on Wikipedia as reflects badly on both the project and the contributor. If you are not the copyright owner in respect of the videos linked (including any music, screen-shots or computer generated content), please consider reading both (WP:EL) as well as You Tube's Terms and conditions. If you don't own the copyright to the footage in entirety you should NOT upload it on You Tube either. If you are indeed the copyright owner in entirety for the linked videos, please confirm this (via OTRS or appropriate means) for each and every video linked, and mention this in respect of the link(s) concerned. content:
{{italic title}}
{{Taxobox

| image =

| status = VU
| status_system = IUCN3.1
| status_ref = <ref>{{IUCN2014.2|assessors=Delbeek, J.T., Richards, Z.T., Lovell, E.R., Bass, D., Aeby, G. & Reboton, C.|year=2014 |id=133463 |title=Acropora aculeus |downloaded=28 August 2014 }}</ref>
| regnum = [[Animal]]ia
| phylum = [[Cnidaria]]

| familia = [[Acroporidae]]

| species = '''''A. aculeus'''''

| binomial_authority = (Dana, 1846)
| synonyms = 
}}

'''''Acropora aculeus''''' is a species of [[Acroporidae|acroporid]] [[coral]] found throughout the [[Indian Ocean]], the central [[Indo-Pacific]], [[Australia]], southeast Asia, [[Japan]] and the [[East China Sea]]. It is also present in the western [[Pacific Ocean]]. It is particularly susceptible to [[coral bleaching]], disease, and [[crown-of-thorns starfish]] predation. It is also harvested for aquaria.

title: User:Matt08 hcm
content:
Matt Johns grew up in Union City, IN just as every other child would of. He had an exceptionaly amazing parents (Richard and Teresa Johns). As a child Matt made friends and started not only his life long journey that would lead him to where he is in life right now but would eventually lead to the start of Young Adulthood.
Matt, Who is now 18, Had alot of homes growing up. Despite his unstable abode, matt carried onward. He swallowed his pain. Through out middle school he really made his friends that would be with him till today. Middle school Matt always was trying to impress and try to be the best. He was involved heavily in football. In Sixth grade Matt moved to RESC distric which would be his final resting place. In seventh grade Matt had made good friends. He became really good friends with his dearest and bestfriend Alex Sucharda. Alex was a strapping young man who easily became friends with him. The first night he spent the night Nick Johns who is Matts brother, started plaing air guitar KISS and wanted to ride bikes at five thirty that morning. Kinda spoked Alex abit but eventually would become great friends with Nick as well. All threw middle school Matt and Nick was close they always have been. They rarely fight. After completing middle school, Matt became a freshmen. New to UCCHS because he was a freshmen became liked. Had many nicknames. Threw out High School Matt played football for two years and Golf for two years. In highschool Matt stayed friends with Alex, Jesse, and Tyler. Matt's senior year was probably one of his greatest. He became known as the infamous "Matty J Tell 'EM" this is when Matt started his rap career. It was a hit around highschool and sure enough his parents thought it was kool too. Matt couldnt walk down the halls without someone saying his name or recitting a song of his. HighSchool is now comming to an end when he graduates this sunday June 1st. He plans to attend Ivy Tech this fall. For his friends Alex and Jesse and Eric are all planing to attend National Gaurd.

title: User talk:Metropolitan90/Archive 15

{{talkarchive}} {{archive-nav|15}} == [[Four Songs From 'The Obscure' Nominee]] == Re articles based on promo singles such as [[Four Songs From 'The Obscure' Nominee]]. This was a white lable promo sent out for pr - NOT a release! db-a9 was added as the page does not indicate the importance or significance of the subject. Tom McRae has a page - this is not in question - please see [[WP:CSD#A9]] (A9). Thanks. [[User:Snoop God|Snoop God]] ([[User talk:Snoop God|talk]]) 10:27, 2 August 2010 (UTC) * I'm going to have to disagree with you on this. A9 says "An article about a musical recording that does not indicate why its subject is important or significant and where the artist's article does not exist." Therefore, if an artist's article ''does'' exist, the article about their musical recording cannot be speedily deleted under [[WP:CSD#A9]]. A9 can only be applied if there is no article about the recording's artist (and if the article does not indicate the recording's importance or significance). --[[User:Metropolitan90|Metropolitan90]] [[User talk:Metropolitan90|(talk)]] 01:36, 3 August 2010 (UTC) == Steven Slater == Do you know that he lied about his confrontation with a passenger about that flight, and that Salter has since refused to talk about the incident? [[User:Patsw|patsw]] ([[User talk:Patsw|talk]]) 14:23, 18 August 2010 (UTC) * I did not know either of these items, but neither one affects his notability in an obvious way. --[[User:Metropolitan90|Metropolitan90]] [[User talk:Metropolitan90|(talk)]] 23:25, 18 August 2010 (UTC) == SNAFU == Hello M, sorry for the blunder just now on [[User talk:SuperSonicSpeed/Archive]], if CSD does not apply here then what does? I mean the account is a blocked sockpuppet of a BANNED editor →{{User|GEORGIEGIBBONS}}←. Per [[WP:DENY]] & [[WP:RBI]], shouldn't we be removing all these garbage on sight, especially after they've long been blocked? Thoughts? --[[User:Dave1185|Dave]] [[user talk:Dave1185|♠♣♥♦№1185♪♫™]] 19:21, 21 August 2010 (UTC) * I would recommend taking the pages to [[WP:MFD]] instead. [[WP:CSD#G5]] just does not apply because it's a user talk page that various other editors used to communicate with the person, even though he was a sockpuppet of a banned editor. And I can't find any other speedy deletion criterion that could apply in this situation. --[[User:Metropolitan90|Metropolitan90]] [[User talk:Metropolitan90|(talk)]] 19:37, 21 August 2010 (UTC) ::* Many thanks for pointing that out to me, have done nominating it on MfD. Cheers~! --[[User:Dave1185|Dave]] [[user talk:Dave1185|♠♣♥♦№1185♪♫™]] 19:46, 21 August 2010 (UTC) == forum == Thanks — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Joseph507357|Joseph507357]] ([[User talk:Joseph507357|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Joseph507357|contribs]]) == Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Spieprzaj dziadu! (2nd nomination) == Hi, I added some more links to pages showing the article's notability and was just wondering if you'd seen them. See [http://www.redakcja.newsweek.pl/Tekst/Polityka-Polska/534194,Spieprzaj-dziadu-nie-zniewazylo-lecha-kaczynskiego.html this Newsweek article], this [[Gazeta Wyborcza]] [http://info.wyborcza.pl/temat/wyborcza/spieprzaj+dziadu list of articles] including the phrase and this [http://news.google.com/archivesearch?pz=1&cf=all&ned=us&hl=en&q=Spieprzaj+dziadu&cf=all google news page] on the frequency of the phrase being mentioned in the press. I also expanded the article itself a bit. Would these things convince you of the phrase's noteworthiness? Thanks for your time. [[User:Malick78|Malick78]] ([[User talk:Malick78|talk]]) 21:30, 28 August 2010 (UTC) * I will take a look and then decide whether to reconsider my earlier recommendation. --[[User:Metropolitan90|Metropolitan90]] [[User talk:Metropolitan90|(talk)]] 01:11, 29 August 2010 (UTC) ** Thanks. [[User:Malick78|Malick78]] ([[User talk:Malick78|talk]]) 11:24, 29 August 2010 (UTC) == Speedy deletion of [[Sri sri aathkhelia bornaamghar]] == I am surprised that you don't want to delete this article. A simple search on google will show you that the term '''aathkhelia bornaamghar''' exists nowhere else on the web but now in wikipedia. For the benefit of the author, I assume it is a test page. [[User:Shenhemu|Shenhemu]] ([[User talk:Shenhemu|talk]]) 10:25, 5 September 2010 (UTC) *Not being able to find the subject on the web makes it hard to [[WP:V|verify]], perhaps non-[[WP:N|notable]] or even a [[WP:HOAX|hoax]], but none of those are the same as being a test page. If somebody posted something that looked like this: Insert formula here[[Link title]] == Headline text ==#REDIRECT [[Target page name]]Subscript text''Italic text'' then I would assume it was a test page because the person was trying out the various ways of Wikipedia formatting. But a short article about something that cannot be identified on the web is not a test page. --[[User:Metropolitan90|Metropolitan90]] [[User talk:Metropolitan90|(talk)]] 17:36, 5 September 2010 (UTC) *OK, I guess I should mark [[Sri sri aathkhelia bornaamghar]] non-notable. Thanks for explaining the true meaning of test page! [[User:Shenhemu|Shenhemu]] ([[User talk:Shenhemu|talk]]) 05:35, 6 September 2010 (UTC) ==Alistair Kidd== Hi Metropolitan. I noticed you had changed the db-hoax tag I had put to db-bio. I just wanted to explain that the db-hoax tag was not put because the kid did not exist (he obviously does), but because the claims of directing serials et al that had been put seemed hoaxes (due to non-availability of any rs). Just thought I'll clarify, nothing else. Thanks and warm regards.[[User:Wifione|''' ♪ ♫ Wifione ♫ ♪ ''']] [[User talk:Wifione|'''―Œ ♣Łeave Ξ мessage♣''']] 18:00, 5 September 2010 (UTC) *I thought it was a non-hoax because the article was talking about him making YouTube videos. I figured that he might have been filming those serials for YouTube in a way that was true, just not notable. --[[User:Metropolitan90|Metropolitan90]] [[User talk:Metropolitan90|(talk)]] 00:22, 6 September 2010 (UTC) == Refusal of deleton request ([[Christoph brüx]]) == Hi, I have a question regarding [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Christoph_br%C3%BCx&diff=next&oldid=383326334 this]. Forgive me if I understood something wrong (my home wiki is the german one, not the english one). The man's name ist Christoph Brüx, not brüx. The article's creator made a mistake and [[User talk:Hyronimus299|asked for help]] because he doesn't know how to move articles. The article was moved to the right name with capital ″B". Isn't it consensus in en-WP to delete this kind of wrong redirects? Greetings --[[User:Schniggendiller|Schniggendiller]] [[User Talk:Schniggendiller| talk ]] 21:57, 6 September 2010 (UTC) *Actually, there is no such consensus in the English Wikipedia. [[Wikipedia:Naming conventions (capitalization)#Software characteristics]] says that such redirects are unnecessary, but harmless. If someone had created [[Christoph Brüz]] in error instead of the correct spelling [[Christoph Brüx]], that erroneous redirect should be deleted. But a redirect with correct spelling but incorrect capitalization can just be left alone because it doesn't make any difference. --[[User:Metropolitan90|Metropolitan90]] [[User talk:Metropolitan90|(talk)]] 01:39, 7 September 2010 (UTC) :Hmm, okay, I will keep this in mind as an example for "rules & procedures contrary to their counterparts in de-WP" :-) Thanks for your explanation. Greetings --[[User:Schniggendiller|Schniggendiller]] [[User Talk:Schniggendiller| talk ]] 01:31, 8 September 2010 (UTC) == Stub == Hello! This [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Prekmurian_dialect&action=historysubmit&diff=384091337&oldid=383995678 list is incomplete], hence stub. [[User:Doncsecz|Doncsecz]][[User talk:Doncsecz|talk]] 08:03, 11 September 2010 (UTC) *I understand what you meant now, so I have attached the {{tl|inc-lit}} template to the list saying, "This literature-related list is incomplete; you can help by expanding it." This is more specific than the "stub" template, which normally refers to the entire article. The whole article would not be classified as a [[Wikipedia:Stub|stub]] just because part of it is incomplete. --[[User:Metropolitan90|Metropolitan90]] [[User talk:Metropolitan90|(talk)]] 16:29, 11 September 2010 (UTC) Thank you. [[User:Doncsecz|Doncsecz]][[User talk:Doncsecz|talk]] 17:14, 11 September 2010 (UTC) {{tb|69.181.249.92}} == Discussion [[List of Hindu temples in Poland]] == User--''' Blanchardb''' -[[User:Blanchardb|Me]]•[[User Talk:Blanchardb|MyEars]]•[[Special:Contributions/Blanchardb|MyMouth]]- through marking my article [[List of Hindu temples in Poland]] has made a mistake. There were no logical and objective reasons for such an action. But obviously he's unable to recognize it. He wants a revenge instead by repeatedly deleting my article without any reasons, and in my opinion his behaviour is completely incompatible with his desire to become an administrator of Wikipedia. But you're right that my remarks about --''' Blanchardb''' -[[User:Blanchardb|Me]]•[[User Talk:Blanchardb|MyEars]]•[[Special:Contributions/Blanchardb|MyMouth]]- were too rude and unnecessary in such a discussion. If you know of an interesting fact from another recently created article, then please suggest it on the [[:Template talk:Did you know|Did you know? talk page]]. }} — [[User:Rlevse|Rlevse]] • [[User_talk:Rlevse|Talk]] • 12:03, 13 October 2010 (UTC) == http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SoNoLita == Why did you delete my page? I can assure you it is not a hoax. On what grounds do you decide whether a topic is a hoax or not and what qualifies you to make that judgement? I have spent a considerable amount of my free time trying to launch this campaign and I don't really understand what it is about it that leads you to believe that it is not genuine. I spent several days making the page and researching the topic. I made many edits. I sought and received feedback. And still, the day of going live, the page is deleted by you. What recourse do i have in such a situation? I am keen to get my page back up. [[User:DoctorOm|DoctorOm]] ([[User talk:DoctorOm|talk]]) 16:30, 16 October 2010 (UTC) *I have restored the page [[SoNoLita]] to allow further review, but I have added multiple tags of "citation needed" and "who" to the article to indicate the lack of sourcing and vagueness. As explained on [[Talk:SoNoLita]] by another editor, this article has no sources to discuss the campaign to establish SoNoLita as a recognized neighborhood, and your statement that you "have spent a considerable amount of [your] free time trying to launch this campaign" supports what [[User:Beyond My Ken]] wrote, that the article was created by the person who was trying to campaign for the establishment of the neighborhood, which would be a [[WP:COI|conflict of interest]]. --[[User:Metropolitan90|Metropolitan90]] [[User talk:Metropolitan90|(talk)]] 17:01, 16 October 2010 (UTC) ::Since the creator would obviously dispute it, I'll skip PRODing the article and go right to AfD. [[User:Beyond My Ken|Beyond My Ken]] ([[User talk:Beyond My Ken|talk]]) 17:03, 16 October 2010 (UTC) :::Actually, the article '''''is''''' a "hoax", since it's written as if the neighborhood actually exists. while the author's comments here make it clear that he or she is attempting to bring it into existence, so the article is saying something that is patently untrue, despite the accurate descriptions of the places inside this "neighborhood". Wikipedia is not an advertising medium to be used for promotion of anyone's favorite cause or program. [[User:Beyond My Ken|Beyond My Ken]] ([[User talk:Beyond My Ken|talk]]) 17:44, 16 October 2010 (UTC) ==DYK nomination of Roger Friedman== [[Image:Symbol question.svg|25px]] Hello! Your submission of [[Roger Friedman]] at the [[Template talk:DYK|Did You Know nominations page]] has been reviewed, and there still are some issues that may need to be clarified. Please review the comment(s) underneath '''{{T:TDYK|Roger Friedman|your nomination's entry}}''' and respond there as soon as possible. Thank you for contributing to Did You Know! [[User:Yoninah|Yoninah]] ([[User talk:Yoninah|talk]]) 22:49, 17 October 2010 (UTC) ==DYK for Roger Friedman== {{tmbox |style = notice |image = [[Image:Updated DYK query.svg|15px|Updated DYK query]] |text = On [[Wikipedia:Recent_additions#20 October 2010|20 October 2010]], '''[[:Template:Did you know|Did you know?]]''' was updated with a fact from the article '''''[[Roger Friedman]]''''', which you recently nominated. If you know of an interesting fact from another recently created article, then please suggest it on the [[:Template talk:Did you know|Did you know? talk page]]. }} [[WP:Did you know|The DYK project]] ([[T:TDYK|nominate]]) 18:04, 20 October 2010 (UTC) ==Searchlight Triple DIvide Point== Hello. (Actual name: Searchlight Triple Divide).. The talk page explains that the divide point was moved over to the SE of Eldorado Valley (a Triple Divide also in NE).. On the link to the discussion page for [[Searchlight Triple Divide Point]] I put the latest (updated version)..[[User:Hike796]] keeps deleting half the page and DISTORTING it... The link (to my original-style page (I assume NOT what you saw), is either here: [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Searchlight_Triple_Divide_Point&diff=394217495&oldid=394213103]... -(and you'll see how much I had to add back)-or the article link to the Discussion page... (I have NOT voted, (and won't), but I'm going to assure each Voter sees the real page.
AND of note, on the Discussion Page I pointed out that the TRIPLE Divide Point is on the [[Great Basin Divide]] ''and'' it borders the [[Colorado River]], and watershed. (the NE point of the same valley does the same as well as being on [[Lake Mead]].[[User:Mmcannis|Mmcannis]] ([[User talk:Mmcannis|talk]]) 19:06, 1 November 2010 (UTC) == RE: [[Template:Mega Model]] == I've had plenty of similar navboxes deleted per CDS G8 where the main article has been deleted, though perhaps the distinction here is that there is a remaining blue link in the template as well as a remainiung transclusion? They may not be explicitly covered by the G8 criteria, but I do think they are covered by the spirit of the criteria. Perhaps this merits some discussion at [[WT:SPEEDY]]? [[User:PC78|PC78]] ([[User talk:PC78|talk]]) 19:31, 7 November 2010 (UTC) == User:Kailashgupta180 == Back in July, [[User:Kailashgupta180]] was repeatedly recreating a mainspace article about himself (I presume), which was speedily deleted about 5 times. The last time, you userfied the page to his main User page. However, since that point, the user has done almost nothing other than edit that page, and add his name and email address to a variety of pages. He did create one article on a village in India which remains, although that article also had his contact info in it...I've tried to communicate twice with the user, as I think he just doesn't get what Wikipedia is. However, I've never received a response, nor has did he respond to any of the messages left by others. Today the user tried to further transform his user page to look like an article (with templates and infoboxes). I'm not quite sure how to proceed; perhaps you could leave another message, or perhaps its time for the user to be blocked per [[WP:NOTMYSPACE]]. I don't see that anyone else has tried to communicate with the user outside of templates, so I don't believe that I can start an RFC/U. Your thoughts? I'll watchlist this, so you can just reply here. [[User:Qwyrxian|Qwyrxian]] ([[User talk:Qwyrxian|talk]]) 06:17, 19 November 2010 (UTC) *After reviewing the situation, I don't have any good advice. I do note that the situation is complicated somewhat by the fact that the user appears to be editing from an IP address now, which could make blocking him more difficult. --[[User:Metropolitan90|Metropolitan90]] [[User talk:Metropolitan90|(talk)]] 06:30, 19 November 2010 (UTC) ::Including editing the village article to add the same info. For now I'll just keep watching and see if regular, rapid reverting discourages him. [[User:Qwyrxian|Qwyrxian]] ([[User talk:Qwyrxian|talk]]) 10:14, 19 November 2010 (UTC) :::Well, if any [[WP:UTM|warnings]] apply to either [[User:Kailashgupta180]] or the IP address, feel free to issue such a warning on their respective user talk page after each future incident of inappropriate editing. --[[User:Metropolitan90|Metropolitan90]] [[User talk:Metropolitan90|(talk)]] 14:41, 19 November 2010 (UTC) == User: Batdanm== Fuck You, You Dickhead! — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:67.116.241.243|67.116.241.243]] ([[User talk:67.116.241.243|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/67.116.241.243|contribs]]) *I take it that this is a reference to [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Justin_Guarini&diff=397753948&oldid=396013887 these] [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Justin_Guarini&diff=next&oldid=397753948 edits] [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Justin_Guarini&diff=next&oldid=397767892 to] [[Justin Guarini]]. However, I have no idea who [[User:Batdanm]] is supposed to be; there's no account registered under that name. --[[User:Metropolitan90|Metropolitan90]] [[User talk:Metropolitan90|(talk)]] 05:24, 20 November 2010 (UTC) ==DYK for Linda J. Wachner== {{tmbox |style = notice |image = [[Image:Updated DYK query.svg|15px|Updated DYK query]] |text = On [[Wikipedia:Recent_additions#21 November 2010|21 November 2010]], '''[[:Template:Did you know|Did you know?]]''' was updated with a fact from the article '''''[[Linda J. Wachner]]''''', which you recently nominated. The fact was ''... that as of 1996, '''[[Linda J. Wachner]]''', then [[chief executive officer]] of [[Warnaco Group]], was the highest paid female corporate executive in the United States?'' If you know of an interesting fact from another recently created article, then please suggest it on the [[:Template talk:Did you know|Did you know? talk page]]. }} [[WP:Did you know|The DYK project]] ([[T:TDYK|nominate]]) 00:03, 21 November 2010 (UTC) == Thanks ... == ... for [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk%3ABlvanderpool&action=historysubmit&diff=398067672&oldid=398064687 this]. I forgot ... Best regards. --[[User:Vejvančický|Vejvančický]] ([[User_talk:Vejvančický|talk]] | [[Special:Contributions/Vejvančický|contribs]]) 15:41, 21 November 2010 (UTC) == [[Wikipedia_talk:Article_titles#Non-Roman_characters_in_article_titles]] == An AfD in which you recently took part has spun off a discussion on the relevant policies and guidelines which may interest you. '''[[user:bobby1011|Handschuh]]'''-[[user talk:bobby1011|talk to me]] 21:32, 21 November 2010 (UTC) == Quick questions == In the DRv for DMFA, you advised future articles 'keep the article's focus on establishing notability for the comic overall rather than describing the characters and plot in detail.' Could you specify or elucidate the line of reasoning here? The article seems similar in structure to other articles about comics/TV shows/movies/etc., so I'm not sure precisely what improvement is being requested. Do you know of a "good" article that can serve as a rubric? Does it just need more footnotes describing the sources for all of the plot material? I can do additional searching to improve the article, if you point me in the right direction. :) Is article text available during DRv? How? [[User:Sim|Sim]] ([[User talk:Sim|talk]]) 14:35, 29 November 2010 (UTC) *While I don't have a really good example to show you was a model, I can say that I would be looking at the number of independent sources that are not the comic itself, as well as the prominence of the sources cited, and the range of sources they came from (i.e. having 5 different articles from 5 different newspapers is better than having 5 articles from the same newspaper). For example, the [[Xkcd]] article deals with a notable webcomic and cites, among other sources, this [http://www.nytimes.com/2008/05/26/business/media/26link.html?_r=1 New York Times article]. That's a great source for establishing notability, but I don't expect all webcomics to be able to establish notability through a New York Times article. And, conversely, the 50 or so citations to Xkcd.com itself in the [[Xkcd]] article don't do anything to establish notability. I am not looking so much for more footnotes describing the sources for all the plot material at this time, because first I would be looking for footnotes establishing that this comic is one I should pay attention to at all. Only after that has been established would I suggest going into detail about the plot. For further guidance, see [[WP:WEB]]. With regard to the article text being available during deletion review, I have gone ahead and temporarily undeleted the page at [[Dan and Mab's Furry Adventures]] so you and everyone else can see what the article most recently looked like. --[[User:Metropolitan90|Metropolitan90]] [[User talk:Metropolitan90|(talk)]] 03:26, 30 November 2010 (UTC) ** Ah, thank you so much; I understand now! Do you think the best bet is for the article to be re-user-ified, so I can go do that? [[User:Sim|Sim]] ([[User talk:Sim|talk]]) 05:01, 3 December 2010 (UTC) ***Probably. You can request that the article be userfied in the deletion review, or if it gets deleted, I or another administrator can [[Wikipedia:Userfy#Userfication of deleted content|userfy]] it for you. (Userfication of the article wouldn't be controversial as long as you do in fact work on it after it is userfied, as opposed to just leaving the content there unchanged.) --[[User:Metropolitan90|Metropolitan90]] [[User talk:Metropolitan90|(talk)]] 05:22, 3 December 2010 (UTC) **** Could you do that? I just checked and it was just closed >.< Also, would you mind taking a look at it when I finish it? I can let you know when, on this talk page. [[User:Sim|Sim]] ([[User talk:Sim|talk]]) 04:50, 4 December 2010 (UTC) *****It's restored now to [[User:Sim/Dan and Mab's Furry Adventures]]. I am willing to look at it again if you let me know when you are finished. --[[User:Metropolitan90|Metropolitan90]] [[User talk:Metropolitan90|(talk)]] 05:14, 4 December 2010 (UTC) ==South Georgia== You're right of course. Given the editor's lack of civility, I couldn't resist this rather feeble joke. Mea culpa [[User:Jimfbleak|Jimfbleak]] - [[User talk:Jimfbleak| talk to me?]] 07:02, 3 December 2010 (UTC) ==Talkback== {{talkback|Drmies|23 Minutes In Hell|ts=17:11, 5 December 2010 (UTC)}} ==DYK for 23 Minutes in Hell== {{tmbox |style = notice |small = |image = [[Image:Updated DYK query.svg|15px|Updated DYK query]] |text = On [[Wikipedia:Recent_additions#10 December 2010|10 December 2010]], '''[[:Template:Did you know|Did you know?]]''' was updated with a fact from the article '''''[[23 Minutes in Hell]]''''', which you created or substantially expanded. The fact was ''... that Bill Wiese claims to have spent '''''[[23 Minutes in Hell]]'''''?'' You are welcome to check how many hits the article got while on the front page ([[User:Rjanag/Pageview stats|here's how]], [http://stats.grok.se/en/201012/23_Minutes_in_Hell quick check]) and add it to [[WP:DYKSTATS|DYKSTATS]] if it got over 5,000. If you know of another interesting fact from a recently created article, then please suggest it on the [[:Template talk:Did you know|Did you know? talk page]]. }} [[WP:Did you know|The DYK project]] ([[T:TDYK|nominate]]) 12:05, 10 December 2010 (UTC) == Carol Welsman == Hello Meteopolitan90, Thanks for recognizing that a [[Carol Welsman]] article is overdue. As a German Wikipedian I appreciate any assistance from native speakers on the English WP. Best wishes --[[User:Hans555|Hans]] ([[User talk:Hans555|talk]]) 08:25, 11 December 2010 (UTC) == more details == With regard to what WTOP had to say about Wali Mohammed. This was an Associated Press article, widely republished, from late winter of 2006. The Associated Press had submitted various FOIA requests for information about the Guantanamo captives. The DoD did not comply with those FOIA requests. They declined, but not under a national security claim, which probably would have succeeded. They declined, claiming they were withholding the information to protect the captives' privacy. US District Court Judge Jed Rakoff ruled against the DoD, ordering them to publish all the information by 6pm 2006-3-3. The DoD only partially complied. They released the transcripts, which were only identified by an ID number. But they withheld all their lists which matched the ID numbers to the captives' names. That list wasn't published for another six weeks. A couple of dozen captives, including Wali Mohammed, had their name uttered during the course of their Tribunals, and so those couple of dozen captives could be identified by name. The Associated Press published a long article that devoted a couple of paragraphs summarizing what the Tribunal transcript said about the captives who could be identified by name. Back in 2006 I didn't expect WTOP to go 404. A year or two ago, after it went 404, I spent some time searching for other publications that reprinted the AP profiles. Unfortunately, different publications often retitle AP stories. And, in this particular instance, publications generally left ''some'' captives out, to make the stories fit in the space they had available. I just looked for the alternate publications. In the time I had available I didn't find any. With more effort I think I could find one, or a couple. Hold the presses, I [http://hosted.ap.org/dynamic/external/onlinenews.ap.org/gtmo/results.php?pageNum_rs_gitmo=2&totalRows_rs_gitmo=50&Submit=Submit&SITE=DCSAS&country=Afghanistan found a copy]. {{quotation|Wali Mohammad said he was handed over to the Americans by Pakistani intelligence agents because he would not pay a bribe. He sold clothing, exchanged currency and had other businesses but owed $1.1 million to 40 people when he was arrested Jan. 24, 2002. He denied that he was in business with the Taliban, smuggled gold for al-Qaida or facilitated transfers from accounts controlled by bin Laden to buy surface-to-air missiles. One witness, who said he had been Afghanistan's transportation minister, said Wali Mohammad borrowed $1.5 million from the Central Bank in 1997-98 but lost it in the foreign exchange market.}} Reading it now it is clear that Wali Mohammed was not the Transport Minister. He was a senior financier. The witness the AP story refers to -- he would have been the Transport Minister. AP is reporting that the bad debt Wali Mohammed incurred was discussed at the Taliban's cabinet level. I think that is notable. IIRC the debt was Taliban regime funds that Wali Mohammed, a trusted financier, had access to for one purpose, but which he used for unauthorized currency speculation in the foreign funds market. I think this would make him the closest thing Taliban era Afghanistan had to a Bernie Madoff. [[User:Geo Swan|Geo Swan]] ([[User talk:Geo Swan|talk]]) 15:21, 11 December 2010 (UTC) ==Angela Slatter== Hi, can you please assist me with this page http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Angela_Slatter. So far you're the only person who has made constructive input. I would like to get this page suitable for inclusion and avoid deletion. [[User:Punkrocker1991|Punkrocker1991]] ([[User talk:Punkrocker1991|talk]]) 00:46, 12 December 2010 (UTC) *If I have any ideas I will let you know. Right now I'm not sure exactly what you should do to improve the article. --[[User:Metropolitan90|Metropolitan90]] [[User talk:Metropolitan90|(talk)]] 02:37, 12 December 2010 (UTC) == Thanks == I've come here to thank you. As I [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Fences_and_windows&diff=402167272&oldid=401979787 wrote here], it has been my experience that practically no one who has disagreed with me over whether the OARDEC memos should be regarded as [[WP:RS]] was prepared to spare the time to read my counter-arguments, and offer a civil and courteous reply. You were a rare exception. I am trying to remember whether anyone else at all took that step. Let me thank you for that. I appreciated it at the time. And I have remembered your collegiality in other discussions. Thanks! It is possible if I were to reread your rebuttal I would be convinced today. I am sorry to tell you that I can't remember when you offered your rebuttal, or where you offered your rebuttal. The key point in the note in the diff I offered above is my suggestion that there should be an [[WP:RFC]] on the question of whether the OARDEC memos should be considered [[WP:RS]]. I have never initiated an RFC. Do you have any advice for me? Thanks for your earlier collegiality and fairness. And thanks in advance for considering offering further advice. Cheers! [[User:Geo Swan|Geo Swan]] ([[User talk:Geo Swan|talk]]) 17:14, 13 December 2010 (UTC) ==Timelimits on userspace drafts== I didn't set out to make more use of userspace pages than other contributors. But it seems I have done so. Our policies are complicated, and are growing more so. Some of those pages have recently triggered other contributors concerns. I see myself as a good faith contributor, and I am prepared to fix those userspace pages I where I inadvertently lapsed from policy. If they can't be fixed I would prefer to delete them myself, so I can do so in an orderly fashion, cannibalizing and re-using the non-problematic portions. Unfortunately I seem to have attracted the scrutiny of some contributors who aren't prepared to grant me the leeway [[WP:User pages]] recommends. I have several concerns over this scrutiny. But I will ask you here about one aspect, since I saw you had already commented on timelimits, and staledrafts. You offered the opinion that a userspace page shouldn't really be considered abandoned until that person who started it had left the project, and had been gone a year. My view is much closer to yours. I presumed your comment implied some obvious provisos. I presume your comment did not apply to userified formerly deleted material. The consensus seems to be that previously deleted material can only be kept in userspace for a limited time, like six months. The consensus seems to be that even previously deleted material that is being actively worked on has to go after six months. From your comment it seemed to me that you would agree that this six month limit should not apply to drafts of new articles. Have I got that right? Would you agree that a userspace page, that started as an article, that was userified, after deletion, could be retained if useful elements, were retained, after removing the elements that triggered the deletion concern were removed, and it was altered so it no longer looked like an article? Thanks! [[User:Geo Swan|Geo Swan]] ([[User talk:Geo Swan|talk]]) 18:32, 13 December 2010 (UTC) *When I recommended allowing userspace drafts to be kept as long as the editor had not abandoned Wikipedia for a full year, I was only thinking about drafts of new articles, not content that had previously been deleted. [[WP:UP#COPIES]] says, "Userspace is not a free web host and should not be used to indefinitely host ... deleted content .... Short term hosting of potentially valid articles and other reasonable content under development or in active use is usually acceptable (the template {{tl|userspace draft}} can be added to the top of the page to identify these)." Whether I would recommend (at [[WP:MFD]]) keeping or deleting a userspace draft of a once-deleted article would depend, in part, on how actively the user seemed to be trying to get the article in condition to return to the mainspace. Of course, I can't speak for everyone. --[[User:Metropolitan90|Metropolitan90]] [[User talk:Metropolitan90|(talk)]] 19:44, 13 December 2010 (UTC) == Errigo deletion == Thanks for the heads-up on Errigo. As I can't remember anything about the article, I trust your judgment. We need to thin out articles on less than notable mafiosi. [[User:Rogermx|Rogermx]] ([[User talk:Rogermx|talk]]) 18:32, 19 December 2010 (UTC) == Christmas Card== {{User:Acather96/Christmas}} == [[Bomb Iran]] == Please note that I have heavily rewritten this article, so please reconsider your "delete" recommendation at [[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Bomb Iran]]. Thanks, [[User:DHowell|DHowell]] ([[User talk:DHowell|talk]]) 06:54, 29 December 2010 (UTC) *I have withdrawn my "delete" recommendation. --[[User:Metropolitan90|Metropolitan90]] [[User talk:Metropolitan90|(talk)]] 14:21, 29 December 2010 (UTC) {{talkarchive}}

title: Northrop X-21
content: {|{{Infobox Aircraft Begin |name = X-21 |image =X21A.jpg |caption = Northrop X-21A }}{{Infobox Aircraft Type |type = experimental aircraft |manufacturer = [[Northrop Corporation|Northrop]] |designer = |first flight = 18 April 1963 |introduced = experimental |retired = [[1968 in aviation|1968]] |status = |primary user = [[National Aeronautics and Space Administration]] (NASA) |more users = |produced = |number built = 2 |unit cost = |developed from = [[Douglas B-66 Destroyer]] |variants with their own articles = }} |} The '''Northrop X-21A''' was an experimental aircraft designed to test wings with [[laminar flow]] control. It was based on the [[Douglas Aircraft Company|Douglas]] [[WB-66D]] airframe, with the wing-mounted engines moved to the rear fuselage and making space for air compressors. The aircraft first flew on 18 April 1963 with [[NASA]] test pilot Jack Wells at the controls.[http://history.nasa.gov/monograph31.pdf American X-Vehicles: An Inventory, June 2003.] Retrieved: 13 February 2007.. Although useful testing was accomplished, the extensive maintenance of the intricate laminar-flow system caused the end of the program. ==Design and development== Laminar-flow control is a technology that offers the potential for significant improvement in [[drag coefficient]] which would provide improvements in aircraft fuel usage, range or endurance that far exceed any known single aeronautical technology. In principle, if 80 percent of wing is laminar, then overall [[Drag (physics)|drag]] could be reduced by 25 percent. The frictional force between the air and the aircraft surface, known as viscous drag, is much larger in a turbulent [[boundary layer]] than in a laminar one. The principal type of active laminar-flow control is removal of a small amount of the boundary-layer air by suction through porous materials, multiple narrow surface slots, or small perforations ([[boundary layer suction]]). Two major modifications were required, the first involving the standard underwing podded [[Allison J71]] engines being removed and replaced by a pair of {{convert|9490|lb-f|kN|0|abbr=on}} static thrust [[General Electric J79|General Electric XJ79-GE-13]] non-afterburning turbojets mounted in pods attached to the rear of the fuselage sides. Bleed air from the J79 engines was fed into a pair of underwing fairings, each of which housed a "bleed-burn" turbine which sucked the boundary layer air out through the wing slots. The X-21A test vehicles (''55-0408'' and ''55-0410'') also incorporated sophisticated laminar flow control systems built into a completely new wing of increased span and area, with a sweep reduced from 35° to 30°. The wing had a multiple series of span-wise slots (800,000 in total Winchester 2005 p. 297.) through which turbulent boundary-layer was "sucked in," resulting in a smoother laminar flow. Theoretically, reduced drag, better fuel economy and longer range could be achieved.Baugher, Joe. [http://home.att.net/~jbaugher2/b66_6.html Northrop X-21A] Retrieved: 14 February 2007. The forward cockpit carried a pilot and two flight engineers while two additional flight test engineers were housed in a central fuselage bay underneath the wing. ==Testing== [[File:X21.jpg|thumb|X-21A in testing]] In initial testing there were significant problems with the porous materials and surface slots getting plugged with debris, bugs, even rain. In certain conditions, ice crystals would form due to the rapid cooling of air over those laminar surfaces abruptly disrupting laminar flow, causing rapid melting and rapid transition back to turbulent flow. Maximum achievement of 95 percent laminar flow over those areas was desired. However, the design effort was canceled due to the plugging problems. Nevertheless, pioneering data was obtained in the X-21 flight program, including the effects of surface irregularities, boundary-layer turbulence induced by three-dimensional span-wise flow effects in the boundary layer (referred to as span-wise contamination) and degrading environmental effects such as ice crystals in the atmosphere.Chambers, Joseph R. [http://www.history.nasa.gov/monograph39/mon39_a.pdf Laminar-flow Control: The Holy Grail of Aerodynamics] NASA, p. 133–134. ==Disposition== Both X-21As ended up in storage at [[Edwards Air Force Base]], California where gradually, they became derelicts, used primarily as photo targets. The remains can still be viewed but no efforts have been made to recover a single example for restoration or display.Jenkins, Dennis R. ''X-Planes Photo Scrapbook''. North Branch, Minnesota: Specialty Press, 2004. ISBN 1-58007-076-0 ==Specifications (X-21A)== [[File:Northrop X-21A takeoff.jpg|thumb|right|The X-21A lifts off on its first flight]] {{aircraft specifications |plane or copter?= plane |jet or prop?= jet |ref= |crew= Five |capacity= |length main= 75 ft 3 in |length alt= 22.94 m |span main= 93 ft 6 in |span alt= 28.51 m |height main= 25 ft 7 in |height alt= 7.8 m |area main= 1,250 ft² |area alt= 116.17 m² |airfoil= |empty weight main= 45,828 [[pound (mass)|lb]] |empty weight alt= 20,783 kg |loaded weight main= 83,000 lb |loaded weight alt= 37,727 kg |useful load main= |useful load alt= |max takeoff weight main= |max takeoff weight alt= |more general= |engine (jet)= [[General Electric J79]]-GE-13 |type of jet=[[turbojet]]s |number of jets=2 |thrust main= 9,400 [[pound-force|lbf]] |thrust alt= 41.9 kN |thrust original= |afterburning thrust main= |afterburning thrust alt= |max speed main= 487 [[knot (unit)|kn]] |max speed alt= 560 mph, 896 km/h |cruise speed main= |cruise speed alt= |never exceed speed main= |never exceed speed alt= |stall speed main= |stall speed alt= |range main= 4,156 [[nautical mile|NM]] |range alt= 4,780 mi, 7,697 km |ceiling main= 42,500 ft |ceiling alt= 12,957 m |climb rate main= |climb rate alt= |loading main= |loading alt= |thrust/weight= |power/mass main= |power/mass alt= |more performance= |armament= |avionics= }} ==See also== {{Portal|United States Air Force}} {{aircontent| |related= * [[B-66 Destroyer]] |similar aircraft= |sequence= [[Hiller X-18|X-18]] - [[Curtiss-Wright X-19|X-19]] - [[X-20 Dyna-Soar|X-20]] - '''X-21''' - [[Bell X-22|X-22]] - [[X-23 PRIME|X-23]] - [[Martin-Marietta X-24|X-24]] |lists= |see also=}} ==References== ;Notes {{Reflist}} ;Bibliography {{Refbegin}} * Winchester, Jim. ''X-Planes and Prototypes''. London: Amber Books Ltd., 2005. ISBN 1-904687-40-7. * [http://users.dbscorp.net/jmustain/x21.htm "X-Planes Detailed Data - Northrop X-21A"] Retrieved: 14 February 2007. {{Refend}} ==External links== {{Commons category|Northrop X-21}} * [http://www.globalsecurity.org/military/systems/aircraft/x-21.htm Globasecurity.org - X-21 Laminar Flow Control] * [http://aeroweb.brooklyn.cuny.edu/specs/northrop/x-21a.htm aeroweb.brooklyn.cuny.edu - Northrop X-21A] {{Northrop aircraft}} {{X-planes}} [[Category:Edwards Air Force Base]] [[Category:United States experimental aircraft 1960–1969|X-21, Northrop]] [[Category:Northrop aircraft|X-021]] [[Category:High-wing aircraft]] [[Category:Twinjets]]

title: User talk:Tyrande~enwiki
content:
== Your account will be renamed ==
Hello, The developer team at Wikimedia is making some changes to how accounts work, as part of our on-going efforts to provide new and better tools for our users like cross-wiki notifications. These changes will mean you have the same account name everywhere. This will let us give you new features that will help you edit and discuss better, and allow more flexible user permissions for tools. One of the side-effects of this is that user accounts will now have to be unique across all 900 Wikimedia wikis. See [[m:Special:MyLanguage/Single User Login finalisation announcement|the announcement]] for more information. Unfortunately, your account clashes with another account also called Tyrande. To make sure that both of you can use all Wikimedia projects in future, we have reserved the name Tyrande~enwiki that only you will have. If you like it, you don't have to do anything. If you do not like it, you can [[Special:GlobalRenameRequest|pick out a different name]]. If you think you might own all of the accounts with this name and this message is in error, please visit [[Special:MergeAccount]] to check and attach all of your accounts to prevent them from being renamed. Your account will still work as before, and you will be credited for all your edits made so far, but you will have to use the new account name when you log in. Sorry for the inconvenience. Yours,
[[m:User:Keegan (WMF)|Keegan Peterzell]]
Community Liaison, Wikimedia Foundation
03:27, 20 March 2015 (UTC) == Renamed ==

title: Roger Cruttenden
content:
{{Use dmy dates|date=March 2016}}
{{Use British English|date=March 2016}}
'''Roger Cruttenden''' (born 5 October 1944) was an [[England|English]] [[cricket]]er. He was a right-handed batsman and a right-arm medium-fast bowler who played for [[Berkshire County Cricket Club|Berkshire]]. He was born in [[Hastings]].

Cruttenden made two appearances for Kent Second XI between 1967 and 1968, though he played no further cricket for seven years.

Cruttenden's sole List A appearance came during the 1979 Gillette Cup competition, against [[Durham County Cricket Club|Durham]]. Crutenden scored 26 not out in the innings, Berkshire's second highest score of the match, and took figures of 1-52.

Cruttenden continued to play for Berkshire in the Minor Counties Championship throughout 1979.

==External links==
*[http://cricketarchive.com/Archive/Players/34/34551/34551.html Roger Cruttenden] at Cricket Archive

title: User:Vickyfisher/Bonsai warriors
content:
{{Userspace draft|source=ArticleWizard|date=February 2012}} <!-- Please leave this line alone! -->

'''Bonsai Warriors''' ...

by Vicky Fisher
Welcome to the Bonsai Warriors website and thanks for visiting!
People have asked me how I came up with the idea of trees as eco-warriors designed to save mankind from global warming.
In short the idea was born 11 years ago when I visited the lovely Huntington Gardens in Los Angeles. The bonsais they had on display reminded me of little soldiers. I saw them springing to life at any minute and scampering away on those tiny, delicate roots.
I concocted the story as I drove home but as with many good intentions it took a back seat as life took over and two children, one divorce and a change of career later meant I was too distracted to start writing.
That was until my family asked me what I had done with the bonsai story that I had mentioned all those years ago. I felt guilty so I made the time to put these wonderful characters down on paper. That is why the book is dedicated to my family because without their encouragement, the story would still not exist in written form.
I hope you all enjoy reading the book as much as I enjoyed writing it.
Let’s hope that someday science can truly come up with such a miracle to help us get out of the environmental mess we find ourselves in today.

THE WORLD NEEDS A SUPERHERO WHO CAN ACTUALLY SAVE THE DAY and guess what?    We've found them!

Having trouble getting your kids to read?   Tired of reading about vampires and wizards?   Look no further! 

Bonsai Warriors is a rollicking eco-adventure that is guaranteed to keep torches glowing under bedcovers for years to come! And yes parents, it will appeal to you too!

Here's the blurb (what it's all about):

When Henry Lewis locked himself away from the world to invent a cure for global warming even he could not have predicted the bizarre chain of events that would follow. 

Suddenly unable to protect his inventions, the fate of humanity and the planet itself falls onto the small shoulders of Toby, his ten year old grandson, who must protect Henry's inventions from falling into the wrong hands.

Bonsai Warriors is a rollicking suspense story guaranteed to keep flashlights glowing under bed covers for years to come.

So what are you waiting for?

Let's get out there and make a difference!

DID YOU KNOW: that Bonsai Warriors is 100% Australian made and manufactured? 
Everything to do with this book has remained on Ozzie soil so the carbon footprint is much smaller than books that are written here but printed overseas then shipped back via carbon belching vessels.

See for yourself why Bonsai Warriors is the biggest thing since Harry Potter. Here is chapter 1

Something was moving in the dark, its steps were short but fast; the breathing choppy and erratic.
As it brushed past shrubs with ever increasing speed, it was apparent there were more right behind it. The things scurried off into the darkness, too quick to identify. 
They moved quickly through the grass and forested area. They seemed to know exactly where they were going and what they were doing.
The front gate loomed ahead, big, white and angled toward the ground. The things leapt over it without hesitation. They had done this before.
One of the things stopped at the edge of the roadway, looked around then whistled for the others to follow. As they crossed, they separated, each moving to a different house.
One of them ducked down the side of a modest looking home. It scrambled up the side of the wall and pulled itself up onto a window ledge.
Through the glass it saw a ten year old boy getting into bed. He struggled for breath as his mother fussed over him, handing him a Ventolin inhaler and plugging in a large machine right next to his bed. The boy took two squirts of the inhaler then lay down. His mother kissed him goodnight and turned off the bedside lamp.
Within seconds, the thing could hear snoring; the boy had fallen asleep. It silently pulled the boy’s window open and landed softly on the carpet. It moved to the machine and watched curiously as it beeped ever so softly to indicate oxygen levels in the room. With a swift flick of a finger, the thing switched the machine off. It fell silent.
The boy let out a short, sharp grunt.


‘He can’t breathe. He can’t breathe. Someone! Help me!’ 
The doors of the Reflection Bay Hospital emergency department swung open as a stretcher carrying the same ten year old boy was wheeled into the busy room already crowded with patients, doctors and nurses. His mother was right behind him looking panicked. 
The emergency room registrar and two nurses raced to the boy and fixed an oxygen mask to his face.
‘Is that you Toby?’ the registrar asked.
‘Hello, Dr. Nigel.’ Toby mouthed through his mask.
‘I’m surprised to see you back here so soon! Isn’t the oxygen machine working, Polly?’ Dr Nigel asked Toby’s mother.
‘Yes. He’s been doing so well lately. He wakes up and he’s so healthy. I can’t understand this,’ Polly sobbed.
Dr Nigel placed a comforting hand on Toby’s shoulders. ‘Why don’t you tell me what happened.”
‘I was walking to school and I dropped my ball in the bushes. I went in to get it and then I couldn’t breathe again.’
‘I don’t understand. What could have caused this?’ Polly wasn’t masking her panic very well. 
Dr. Nigel rubbed his chin. ‘Half the city’s sick with some sort of breathing complaint. I’d say this was some sort of reaction to a tree or a bush. I’d keep him away from any sort of new vegetation for a while.’
‘Did you hear that Toby?’ Polly took Toby’s hand. ‘No trees and no bushes! And I’m driving you to school from now on!’
Toby nodded and mumbled through the oxygen mask, ‘Yes mum!’
Dr. Nigel squeezed his hand. ‘Keep using that oxygen machine at night, you hear?’
‘Yes sir!’

Toby’s father was waiting anxiously in the family’s sedan, tapping the steering wheel. He exhaled a sigh of relief as he saw Toby and Polly leaving through the sliding doors. 
‘What took so long? I was getting worried,’ he said as he jumped out of the car and enveloped them in a bear hug. 
‘Oh Brian, Dr. Nigel thinks it might have been a plant,’ Polly explained. ‘We have to keep him away from trees and bushes.’
‘With the rate they’re cutting them down in Reflection Bay, that won’t be a problem at all,’ Brian laughed. ‘Hey Toby, did you tell the Doc we got here in world record time?’
‘Sorry dad. I forgot.’
‘Nigel might actually be impressed if we hadn’t had so much practice!’ Polly teased.
As they drove home, Toby stared at the passing scenery. The city skyline jutted through a thick layer of orange haze like dirty black fingers. A huge bill poster advertised Reflection Bay as the tourist destination of the year as voted by the residents of Reflection Bay. The pollution was so dense Toby couldn’t see much more.
He looked out the other window and through the dim light, could just make out a large hill in the middle of the city. A dome of clear, clean air covered the thick forest growing there.
Brian turned the family car into a street that ran along the boundary of the hill. Toby’s house was one of the modest three bedroom dwellings that backed onto its perimeter. 
As Brian pulled into the driveway, Toby focused on the high metal fence separating their backyard from the vast expanse of the forest. He had no idea why, but he felt a strange connection to the place. He’d wanted to go exploring around it for as long as he could remember but there were rumors of a crazy old scientist who lived there who ate little kids who strayed onto his property. What’s more, a boy at school told him that the crazy old man had a dog who chewed on the bones once the old man was done.
Toby shivered in his seat. Exploration would have to wait.

title: User:Daev
content:
==About Me==

[[Image:Flag of Canada.svg|My home country|thumb|100px]]

== Welcome == {| style="background-color:#F5FFFA; padding:0;" cellpadding="0" |class="MainPageBG" style="border:1px solid lightgrey; background-color:lightgrey; vertical-align:top; color:#000000; font-size:85%"| {| width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="5" style="vertical-align:top; background-color:lavender; padding:0;" !
Hello, Ycelestial! '''[[Wikipedia:Introduction|Welcome]] to Wikipedia!''' Thank you for [[Special:Contributions/Ycelestial|your contributions]]. You may benefit from following some of the links below, which will help you get the most out of Wikipedia. If you have any questions you can ask me on my talk page, or place '''{{helpme}}''' on your [[Help:Using talk pages|talk page]] and ask your question there. Please remember to [[Wikipedia:Signatures|sign your name]] on talk pages by clicking [[File:Insert-signature.png|link=Wikipedia:How to sign your posts|alt=]] or by typing four tildes "~~~~"; this will automatically produce your name and the date. If you are already excited about Wikipedia, you might want to consider being "[[Wikipedia:Adopt-a-user|adopted]]" by a more experienced editor or joining a [[Wikipedia:WikiProject|WikiProject]] to collaborate with others in creating and improving articles of your interest. Click [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Council/Directory|here]] for a directory of all the WikiProjects. Finally, please do your best to always fill in the [[Help:Edit summary|edit summary]] field when making edits to pages. title: Talk:Took (The Wire)
content: {{WikiProject Television|class=stub|importance=low|episode-coverage=yes|episode-coverage-importance=low}} {{WikiProject The Wire}}}} == Belzer's cameo- 3 sources say he was playing John Munch == According to imdb, National Public Radio [http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=19089991] and USA Today [http://blogs.usatoday.com/entertainment/2007/08/belzer-characte.html] Belzer was playing [[John Munch]], but HBO only credits him as a "bar patron". Could this be listed in uncredited appearances or would that be speculation?[[User:JeffStickney|JeffStickney]] ([[User talk:JeffStickney|talk]]) 19:19, 19 February 2008 (UTC) IMDb isn't considered reliable. I'd say write a graph for the guest stars section with those other two refs and state that some reviewers thought the role was Munch but that HBO didn't confirm this and cite the ep summary.--[[User:Opark 77|Opark 77]] ([[User talk:Opark 77|talk]]) 19:47, 19 February 2008 (UTC) :HBO didn't credit him as anything. The show does not list character names in the closing credits. Opark probably listed him as "bar patron" because we can't say for sure that he's supposed to be Munch. How about a "production" section where the Belzer cameo is noted with the NPR and USA Today refs? "I used to run bar." is an obvious reference to Munch as he owned a bar on Homicide. But until he or David Simon confirm that it is Munch, we can't definitely say. [[User:Mrblondnyc|MrBlondNYC]] ([[User talk:Mrblondnyc|talk]]) 05:32, 20 February 2008 (UTC) :Simon comfirms it was Munch in this interview: [http://sepinwall.blogspot.com/2008/03/wire-david-simon-q.html] [[User:Mrblondnyc|MrBlondNYC]] ([[User talk:Mrblondnyc|talk]]) 01:05, 12 March 2008 (UTC) ==Plot Synopsis== How come the plot synopsis is so different in tone to all the previous entries for Wire episodes? Needs a major rewrite...[[Special:Contributions/80.229.225.16|80.229.225.16]] ([[User talk:80.229.225.16|talk]]) 15:03, 2 November 2008 (UTC) Agreed. All of Season five episodes are below par compared to all previous four seasons. --[[User:Vindicta|Vindicta]] ([[User talk:Vindicta|talk]]) 20:02, 17 December 2008 (UTC) Agreed - I am sorely missing the excellent synopses from the previous seasons. Any chance of the original author(s) handling S5? [[Special:Contributions/76.218.69.148|76.218.69.148]] ([[User talk:76.218.69.148|talk]]) == Goodnight Moon == Hey yo, the Goodnight Everybody scene with Kima Greggs is not a reference to the book "Goodnight Moon". Its a reference to [[Clockers_(film)|Clockers]] another work by [[Richard Price|Richard Price]]. Richard Prices confirms the allusion in [[http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=87893862 "an interview"]] with "Fresh Air" host Terry Gross [[User:origen01|origen01]] 17:32, 16 August 2009 (UTC) —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/66.140.58.91|66.140.58.91]] ([[User talk:66.140.58.91|talk]]) (I moved this comment to its own section.)[[Special:Contributions/76.218.69.148|76.218.69.148]] ([[User talk:76.218.69.148|talk]])

title: User talk:Waytoblue~enwiki
content:
== Your account will be renamed ==
Hello, The developer team at Wikimedia is making some changes to how accounts work, as part of our on-going efforts to provide new and better tools for our users like cross-wiki notifications. These changes will mean you have the same account name everywhere. This will let us give you new features that will help you edit and discuss better, and allow more flexible user permissions for tools. One of the side-effects of this is that user accounts will now have to be unique across all 900 Wikimedia wikis. See [[m:Special:MyLanguage/Single User Login finalisation announcement|the announcement]] for more information. Unfortunately, your account clashes with another account also called Waytoblue. To make sure that both of you can use all Wikimedia projects in future, we have reserved the name Waytoblue~enwiki that only you will have. If you like it, you don't have to do anything. If you do not like it, you can [[Special:GlobalRenameRequest|pick out a different name]]. If you think you might own all of the accounts with this name and this message is in error, please visit [[Special:MergeAccount]] to check and attach all of your accounts to prevent them from being renamed. Your account will still work as before, and you will be credited for all your edits made so far, but you will have to use the new account name when you log in. Sorry for the inconvenience. Yours,
[[m:User:Keegan (WMF)|Keegan Peterzell]]
Community Liaison, Wikimedia Foundation
03:35, 20 March 2015 (UTC) == Renamed ==
